Project Manager

Job Description:

This position will coordinate between different teams within the company: sales, warehouses, procurement, logistics, finance, etc. Candidates will serve as first point of contact for communications with different teams to receive demands and requests. Candidates will be required to anticipate and identify problems accurately in a usually intense environment and provide reasonable problem-solving advice to COE Team Leader. Candidates will use data analysis skills and techniques to provide thorough analysis of the company’s everyday operations and draw conclusions about business trends based on such analysis. Candidates are expected to complete analytical reports to help the company’s decision-making progress.

To be successful in this role, you are expected to have superior skills in quantitative analysis and modeling. You are also expected to have great organizational and communication skills. You need to be a hard-working person who is used to working under stress. You need to be able to deal with sophisticated issues in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment. You also need to be a detail-oriented person with a great memory.

Job Responsibilities

1.Warehouse Coordination

Connect the warehouse teams in the U.S. and the procurement and logistics teams in China
Coordinate between the front-end sales and the back-end support team, enhance the communication and feedback procedures among teams
Help the company reduce cost and improve efficiency

2.Data Analysis

Data collection and analysis
Use data to describe and visualize the current conditions and future trends of the company’s business operations
Help business department monitor, identify and analyze problems during everyday operations and provide solutions on a timely basis
Use data analysis and the conclusions drawn from it to provide references for the company’s decision-making process

3.Remediate gaps of exceptional/edge cases

Coordination and communication between all related parties to remediate potential disputes between sales regarding business operations
Help the COE team to achieve a fair resolution that adds value to the company
Monitor the exceptional/edge cases and help establish a procedural system to convert exceptional use cases to standard ones for easier resolutions
Dive deep into the root causes and document the lessons learnt for future references

4.Quality Assessment

Ensure the effectiveness and quality of the warehouse’s daily operations
Help establish and polish the company’s quality assurance system

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree or above with background in Economics, Finance, Accounting, Statistics, Data Science and other related fields
Fluent in both Mandarin Chinese and English
Proficiency in Office tools, especially Excel, at a level sufficient for business analysis
3+ years of project management experience
Strong knowledge and experience in business operation systems and financial reporting
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to express thoughts clearly, logically and succinctly

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Proficiency in quantitative analysis tools like R, MATLAB, STATA, SPSS, SQL
Proficiency in programming languages like Python
PMP (Project Management Professional) Certification
Have experience of successfully navigating through fast-paced environment accompanied with ambiguity like startups

Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar:

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.

At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

Our commitment to Quality, Value, and Integrity is the underlying foundation upon which Lennar was built, and these three fundamental principles still guide us in caring for our customers, associates, trade partners, shareholders, and community.

The Division Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.

#CB #LI-VR1

Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirement:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred.
MBA would be helpful.
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred.
Experience in the homebuilding industry would be helpful.
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to work in excess of eight hours per day in the confined quarters of an office. Also requires the ability bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and/or carry items less than 25 pounds. Finger dexterity in operating a computer keyboard and calculator. Requires sitting at a computer monitor for extended periods of time, completing paperwork and to receive/return phone messages.


Additional Requirements:
Demonstrates skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives.
Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise and relatable examples.
Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions.
Engages and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Ability to adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Prioritize and plan work activities, use time efficiently, set goals and objectives and develop realistic action plans.
Think critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem solving situations.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness, look for ways to improve and promote quality, apply feedback to improve performance and monitor own work to ensure quality.
This position outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the Associates. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Lennar is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices and laws.

The Sales Analyst will assist with sales reporting and analytics, sales planning/budgeting, and help with sales data management efforts to create seamless reporting for sales insights and decision-making. This role will be responsible for monitoring various sales initiatives and performance on a regular basis, to maximize performance and revenue, identifying and executing actionable sales improvement initiatives. The analyst will also bring together sales performance and KPI data to help develop the annual sales plan. In addition, the individual in this role will support cross-functional teams including marketing, finance, network, customer service, product, and IT to share the necessary data for making key business decisions.

The position’s goal is to proactively identify trends and factors that will impact actions across product, marketing, and sales. The individual must have a data-driven outlook and a keen understanding of how to analyze disparate data sources around market trends which include competition, customers, product projections, and opportunities.

This person will support the VP Sales Operations to provide in-depth market data analysis and ongoing assessment of market/customer trends to support the Logix Fiber Networks strategy and planning.

Competencies:

· Strong analytical skills and a desire to learn more regarding using data for business recommendations.

· Solid communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to author a range of high-quality deliverables.

· Exceptional MS Excel and PowerPoint skills.

· Working knowledge of CRM systems (i.e. Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce, Hubspot) and the ability to draw insights and make recommendations from the data.

· Advanced knowledge of Tableau.

· Experience querying large relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, DB2, etc).

· Good interpersonal skills necessary to work effectively with colleagues at various levels of the organization.

· Able to organize/manage multiple priorities and projects coupled with the flexibility to quickly adapt to ever changing business questions and needs.

Logix Culture:

Each team member has a responsibility to support and operate in alignment with our culture and company values. The behaviors and actions for each value may be different depending on the team member’s role and are critical to both the success of team members and the company.

Duties/Responsibilities:

· Provide ongoing support for sales reporting and analytics in order to identify growth, targeting, and sales opportunities to help grow the business.

· Create forecasts and projections making use of competitive analysis, past performance metrics, and other indicators to predict future growth and trends.

· Report sales performance on regular basis through key performance metrics, reports, and models for multiple sales channels and make recommendations for improvements.

· Develop segmentation of customer and prospect data base to deliver efficient targeting and sales into key customer profiles.

· Assist with projects such as sales territory refinements, network construction targeting, near and off-net conversion efforts, sales incentives, program ROI, and other activities critical to driving sales.

· Provide support on the CRM platform usage, improvements, and data interpretation.

· Assist with sales planning and budgeting models based on performance and future sales expectations.

· Monitor trends both within and outside the business and identify key areas for improvement or exploration.

· Report on new product assessments and marketing efforts to ensure efficient efforts and drive targeted results.

· Work collaboratively with members from sales, sales operations, solution engineers, marketing, IT, finance and others to ensure effective reporting, analysis, cross-project communication, and issue management.

· Help build, deploy, and track prototype solutions to demonstrate ideas and build value.

· Assist with ad-hoc reports or business presentations to communicate results and learnings as needed by senior management for investors, board members, and other parties.

Required Skills/Abilities:

· Analytical skills in sales planning and analysis with demonstrated examples.

· Fast learner to get up to speed on our business, data sources, systems, etc.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Proven experience improving the efficiency of an analytics function and its effect on organizational performance.

· Innovative, forward thinker and solid abilities in relationship management.

Education and Experience:

· Experience: 5+ years of experience in sales / analysis / consulting / data management.

· Undergraduate Degree in Business or quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, Engineering, etc.).

· Proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Outlook required

· Telecom, data center or other technology experience a plus.

Physical Requirements:

· Prolonged periods of working at a desk and on a computer.

The Business Analyst will bring to the table a strong analytical mindset, communication finesse, and a demonstrated ability of translating a wide range of data inputs into actionable information. This role presents a unique opportunity to collaborate directly with the President and shape the fabric of strategic decision‐making.
1. Collaborate closely with the President to support critical day‐to‐day analytical and tactical follow through needs.
2. Conduct market research, assess data, and develop insights into market trends and pricing strategies.
3. Provides analysis of revenue, market share, and competitor activity to develop optimal market strategies.
4. Conduct elasticity of demand analysis to optimize pricing decisions.
5. Identify opportunities to maximize profitability while maintaining competitiveness.
6. Apply advanced data analysis techniques to extract actionable insights, spot trends, and empower data‐driven decision‐making. Expertly employ sophisticated tools to manipulate and effectively present data.
7. Collaborate with cross‐functional teams to facilitate project planning, monitoring, and tracking, ensuring punctual and precision‐driven project delivery.
8. Assist with the creation of reports and presentations as needed by the President & COO.
9. Maintain a database of historical pricing data to monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of pricing and guide pricing decisions.
10. Develop an intuitive understanding of the marketplace via hands‐on field work with both end users and distributors.
11. Perform all other duties as assigned.
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, or STEM related field. One (1) to three (3) years in a Business Analyst role or equivalent. Strong analytical skills for translating a variety of data inputs into actionable insights. Proficiency in data analysis, data visualization, and tools such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI. High proficiency with Excel is a must. Effective written and verbal communication skills for clear, concise documentation. Detail‐oriented mindset committed to delivering high‐quality work. Self‐starter mentality. Problem‐solving aptitude for identifying issues and proposing solutions. Econometrics and/or quantitative market research familiarity a plus.

Summary

The Payroll & Business Analystwill lead the payroll process for Mowi USA business unit. Will be responsible for processing payroll, providing technical aid and supporting process improvement for Human Resources. The Payroll & Business Analyst will establish the developing of automated payroll processes: increasing payroll functionality, preparing monthly reports and managing payroll functions. Will also be in charge of preparing monthly payroll accrual, assisting with general accounting tasks and the monthly close process. The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Responsibilities

Ensure payroll is processed timely and accurately.
Enter weekly payroll changes (not processed through self-service and HR processes). Audit the payroll register to ensure changes were captured and payroll is accurate.
Develop strong relationships with HR, through partnering with the team and assisting in process improvement related to HR functions and payroll systems. Provide excellent customer service to Mowi employees.
Support HR in the development of resources within Workforce Now, including: recruitment, employee goals and appraisals, reporting and analytical resources.
Provide support in the development of electronic employee files, including: assistance with self-audits and recommendations for improvements.
Support continued development of Workforce Now to provide improved self-service experience and increase self-service use.
Lead annual benefit and compliance reporting and audit processes, including: 401k audit, workers compensation audit, Self-Insured Medical Plan audit, 1095 review, EEO1 filing, etc.
Process weekly 401k contribution upload and reconcile payroll and 401k data.
Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking, payroll and lockbox accounts.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
·Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

**All requirements and skills are considered to be essential, unless otherwise indicated.**

Job Title: Lead Analyst – SAP PRA Business Systems - 2310002255 - Dallas, TX
Job Description:
Summary:

Energy Transfer, is currently seeking an SAP PRA specialist to support their PRA system. The PRA system is heavily customized and will require skills to reverse engineer processes and trouble shoot custom and standard SAP PRA issues. The project went live 6 months ago and requires production support. This position is part of the Accounting and Finance organization and supports the Crude Oil Acquisition and Marketing segment of the Organization. The position will involve working closely with Division Order, Regulatory, Deal Capture, and IT.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Serve as SAP PRA system specialist for the business
Designated by a Business Application Owner to be the business liaison for a specific application function
Should be able to analyze tickets that come in, understand if the solution needed is a code fix, process change or an issue with the master/transaction data.
Understand the customizations in the system by reading documents, debugging and recreating data in the test system
Fix issues arising in the PRA interfaces
Able to resolve issues in Valuation, Payments and other PRA modules in a timely manner
Escalated support of Users, Super Users, and SME's
Work with the Functional Analysts, Technical Analysts, and other technical resources as necessary to resolve issues
Should be able to replicate issues in the test system and reverse engineer processes with minimal supervision
Strong debugging skills will be very helpful
Business requirements definition and prioritization
User acceptance testing coordination (or execution)
Assessment of business process improvement recommendations and prioritization
Proactive business process and application improvement recommendations
Work alongside business as liaison to IT for PRA trouble shooting
Gain knowledge of all marketing contracts, division order processes, and regulatory requirements as they relate to SAP PRA
Prepare and analyze metrics as it relates to the various back office functional teams
Assist management in the creation of system reports
Able to adapt to rapidly changing priorities

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:

Minimum of 5 years of working in SAP with strong knowledge in SAP PRA
Knowledge of check write process in PRA
Experience troubleshooting issues arising in valuation
Knowledge of Contractual Allocations and related processes
Needs to understand the Ownership process, knowledge of cross reference setup and how each PRA module relates to other modules
Able to understand customizations in the system and become comfortable working with them quickly
Strong Analytic skills to understand the root cause of issues
Ability to debug programs to identify the issue will be very helpful as the system is very customized will be very helpful
Experienced in a customized SAP system which requires a lot of troubleshooting
Able to recreate issues in the test system
Analytic and data analysis skills required, especially MS Excel
Strong communication skills
Highly detailed oriented
Able to prioritize and multi-task

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2 - 5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5 - 8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

GM Financial is the wholly owned captive finance subsidiary of General Motors and is headquartered in Fort Worth, U.S. We are a global provider of auto finance solutions, with operations in North America, South America, and the Asia Pacific region. Responsibilities include the gathering and documenting of data requirements to facilitate product enhancements, changes and/or fixes within Fleet Systems applications. Identify risks, impacts, options, and recommendations for mitigation
Create and maintain process flows, component diagrams, and detailed process functionality
Coordinate and lead interaction across multiple platforms and groups in order to produce quality deliverables
Provide direction and mentoring to entry-level Business Analysts
Perform other duties as assigned
Conform with all company policies and procedures

Familiarity with basic data engineering concepts, preferably in a cloud environment
Experience with the software development lifecycl3e

Ability to build consensus, use active listening skills, and to work harmoniously with others in getting the job done while promoting a culture of teamwork, excellence, and integrity
Excellent analytical, organizational, problem-solving, and follow-up skills with the ability to meet time sensitive deadlines
Ability to work on multiple projects and priorities while still maintaining overall productivity and deliverables
Capable of acting as a liaison by relating business issues to internal and external ITS partners, and relating technology solutions to business partners
Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills with all levels of the organization; ability to communicate and present concepts and processes in an easy to understand way to a diverse audience
Ability to read, interpret, and create technical documentation
Ability to write and interpret advanced level SQL queries
Comfortable making decisions after assessing risks and mitigations with little management involvement
Ability to gain and maintain a thorough and advanced working knowledge of GM Financial Fleet Solutions systems both technically and operationally

5-7 years experience within an application development environment in analyzing and implementing data solutions required

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Odoo ERP Business Analyst (BA) to join our dynamic team. As an Odoo ERP BA, you will be responsible for analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes in the Odoo ERP system to streamline operations, improve efficiency, and enhance overall business performance. Your primary focus will be understanding the business needs of various departments and translating them into functional and technical requirements for successful Odoo ERP system deployment and customization.
Roles And Responsibilities
Proven experience (3+ years) as a Business Analyst, preferably in Odoo ERP projects
In-depth knowledge of Odoo ERP modules and configurations.
Business Process Analysis: Collaborate with key stakeholders from different departments to understand their business processes, pain points, and requirements. Analyze existing workflows and propose optimized solutions using Odoo ERP modules and features.
Requirement Gathering: Elicit, document, and prioritize functional and technical requirements from stakeholders, ensuring they align with the organization & strategic goals.
Solution Design: Design and model functional solutions within Odoo ERP, considering system capabilities, scalability, and best practices. Recommend customizations or configurations to address specific business needs.
User Training and Support: Conduct training sessions for end-users to ensure smooth adoption of the Odoo ERP system. Provide ongoing support and address user queries and issues related to the ERP platform.
System Implementation: Collaborate with the development team to configure and customize Odoo modules to meet business requirements. Ensure that the implemented solutions are tested thoroughly and meet quality standards.
Integration: Facilitate integration between Odoo ERP and other business systems, such as CRM, accounting, and inventory management, to ensure data consistency and seamless operations.
Data Migration: Plan and oversee data migration from legacy systems to Odoo ERP, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
Change Management: Assist in change management efforts during Odoo ERP implementation, helping users adapt to new processes and tools.
Documentation: Prepare comprehensive documentation, including functional specifications, process flows, and user manuals, to support system understanding and maintenance.
Continuous Improvement: Stay up-to-date with Odoo ERP advancements, industry best practices, and emerging technologies. Identify opportunities for process improvement and provide insights for business growth
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to translate business needs into technical requirements.
Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and project management methodologies.
Prior experience in ERP implementation, customization, and data migration is a plus.
Certification in Odoo ERP or relevant business analysis certifications will be advantageous.

Reviews operational workflows, documents findings, and provides recommended solutions for improvement. Responsible for analyzing financial information and drawing conclusions to assist business with making decisions. Facilitate training and learning for team members. Mentor peers and assist with new hire selection through peer interviewing.

Travelers offers a hybrid work location model that is designed to support flexibility.
What Will You Do?
FINANCIAL CONTROLS AND ASSESSMENTS: Performs underlying financial controls, and assisting with validations or audits. Performs and analyzes compliance reviews to validate the effectiveness of financial controls, identifies trends and communicates findings to business partners (finance, product, field leadership). Interprets and applies product workflow changes to financial reviews that they are completing. Participates in, presents and explains reviews and trending analyses (that they have completed) during various types of audits and reviews with business and potentially external auditors. Assesses the reasonableness of audited data as well as identifying discrepancies. Validates data against regulatory standards. Reviews controls against state regulatory requirements. Often requires researching state regulatory requirements.
DATA AND INFORMATION MANAGEMENT: Compiles accurate records from multiple sources and information management. Requires research to determine which sources to use. Uses management information data to create and analyze periodic ad hoc reports based on business needs. Updates data discrepancies identified in reports and systems. Completes budget analysis to identify trends in allocated and unallocated expenses. Reviews operational workflows, documents findings, and provides recommended solutions for improvement.
CLAIM OPERATIONAL SERVICE AND PARTNERSHIPS: Serves as subject matter expert to Claim Centers on operational services, processes and logistics/workflows. May lead short-term and long-term projects related to Claim Center operations. Leads operational and workflow projects an Collaborates with peers locally and nationally to share knowledge on financial control processes and operational workflows.
TEAM ENGAGEMENT: Serves as a peer coach and mentor to Operations Specialists and and provides feedback to management on developmental skill gaps and makes recommendations on training needs. Provides input on hiring of Operations Specialists and Analysts. Assists the Operations management team with the onboarding and orientation of new staff. May help with developing workflow resources and training materials/guides. Serves as a resource on new processes for Operations Specialists. May serve as a member of the Enterprise Response Team or Immediate Response Team programs and may hold applicable state adjuster licenses.
CLAIM PAYMENTS AND EXPENSE PROCESSING: Ensures the proper handling of financial transactions (including claim payments, outside vendor invoices, attorney expenses, and medical processing fees. Processes and documents returned/voided checks and credits, ensuring timeliness and accuracy.
Other duties as assigned.
Perform other duties as assigned.
What Will Our Ideal Candidate Have?
Bachelor's Degree.
Two years of business experience, with a customer service focus.
Demonstrated ability to partner with others.
Experience gathering, interpreting and analyzing data.
Experience utilizing computer technology such as Microsoft Office, e-mail, Web-enabled applications, and database software.
ACCOUNTABILITY: Takes ownership and responsibility for actions and outcomes, performance and results;
ANALYTICAL THINKING: Ability to analyze, synthesize and compare information to understand issues and explore alternative solutions.
CHANGE MANAGEMENT/RESILIENCE: Ability to remain energized and focused in the face of ambiguity, change or strenuous demands.
JUDGEMENT/DECISION MAKING: Ability to exercise sound judgment, makes decisions and commit to a position.
RELATIONSHIP MANAGEMENT: Ability to build, foster and maintain productive working relationships to meet goals and achieve results.
What is a Must Have?
High School Diploma or GED.
2 years of business experience, with a customer service focus.
Experience performing data analysis.
What Is in It for You?
Health Insurance: Employees and their eligible family members – including spouses, domestic partners, and children – are eligible for coverage from the first day of employment.
Retirement: Travelers matches your 401(k) contributions dollar-for-dollar up to your first 5% of eligible pay, subject to an annual maximum. If you have student loan debt, you can enroll in the Paying it Forward Savings Program. When you make a payment toward your student loan, Travelers will make an annual contribution into your 401(k) account. You are also eligible for a Pension Plan that is 100% funded by Travelers.
Paid Time Off: Start your career at Travelers with a minimum of 20 days Paid Time Off annually, plus nine paid company Holidays.
Wellness Program: The Travelers wellness program is comprised of tools and resources that empower you to achieve your wellness goals. In addition, our Life Balance program provides access to professional counseling services, life coaching and other resources to support your daily life needs. Through Life Balance, you’re eligible for five free counseling sessions with a licensed therapist.
Volunteer Encouragement: We have a deep commitment to the communities we serve and encourage our employees to get involved. Travelers has a Matching Gift and Volunteer Rewards program that enables you to give back to the charity of your choice.
Employment Practices
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that we can deliver the very best products and services when our workforce reflects the diverse customers and communities we serve. We are committed to recruiting, retaining and developing the diverse talent of all of our employees and fostering an inclusive workplace, where we celebrate differences, promote belonging, and work together to deliver extraordinary results.

Job Description

A business analyst within Tempo Service has many different responsibilities. The responsibilities would include analysis of financials as well as operational data. The candidate would be comfortable as a change advocate and would thrive on person-to-person communication. The candidate would also need to portray strong organizational and time management skills to succeed. Since this position requires problem solving at a high level the candidate needs the ability to communicate in person, and in written form, how objectives are to be achieved.

Duties and Responsibilities included but not limited to:


Gather and analyze data to support the divisional goals and to help create a culture of data driven decisions.

Document Processes and streamline inefficiencies.



Research, document, and help promote new business initiatives.



Coordinate with different departmental teams to produce better business outcomes



Test business processes and recommend improvements.



General reporting, revenue, cost, and profitability reporting

Inventory configuration and maintenance

Software integration (new and existing)

Technical skills


Basic analytics skills
Proficient ability with Microsoft Office Suite especially Excel
Report generation capabilities including graphics
Proficient ability to read, write, and edit SQL queries
Comfortable being a change advocate


Management/Organization Skills


Strong capability to communicate the key messages of analytics to business partners.
Strong proficiency to be able to effectively communicate to all business partners on topics such as different technologies, project management, and the status in which projects are in.
Strong project management skills with the capabilities to start a project and finish it on communicated timelines.
Capable of Organizing team members and being able to delegate responsibilities to achieve objectives within a project.
Ability to value projects based on metrics that translate into dollars saved or gained.
Record tasks and time spent on varying projects.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. Position Summary

The Clinical Client Operations - Analyst will be responsible for analyzing Client's specialty benefit requests and inputting data into RxClaim to maintain specialty benefits (pricing, co-pays, grace fills, etc.) and building of new Specialty benefits for clients. The Analyst's duties will emphasize data analysis and review of client documentation to determine client intent for their specialty benefit. Analysis will be completed using RxClaim and analytical tools (i.e. MS Excel and MS Access) in support of specialty builds and maintenance. Other duties will include RxClaim query, data analysis, manual updates to RxClaim, testing changes using EZ- Test and macros and reviewing test claims for accuracy. The Analyst will also use SalesForce to track work and monitor TAT. The Analyst will confirm client intent when necessary and ensure complete client documentation is included with all request.


Required Qualifications
1 year prior work experience in Microsoft applications, RxClaim Coding, RxClaim Query/EZ Query

Preferred Qualifications
SalesForce.com Experience
Certified Pharmacy Technician Experience

Education High School Diploma or GED required
Bachelor Degree preferred

$40,600.00 - $83,400.00

The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

DSI Systems Inc., an authorized AT&T Representative partner, has an immediate career opportunity motivated individual to fill one of our key roles as a Business Analyst.
Are you passionate about weaving insights from data into compelling narratives? Do you have a knack for transforming raw data into actionable stories that drive business success? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Business Analyst.

As the Business Analyst, you will collaborate cross-functionally with multiple teams to collect data and provide insights to support decision-making. You will identify patterns and trends looking for opportunities to optimize our business. To succeed in this role, you must excel at implementing initiatives and making recommendations for improvements based on data analysis.

*You will be asked to complete a data visualization exercise as a part of the hiring process*

About DSI

DSI is a family-owned company that has been in business since 1984. We provide enhanced value that delivers results for our clients and partners, through sales management, marketing assistance, hardware logistic solutions, immersive training, engineering expertise, and proprietary software solutions.

We believe that relationships are the most important part of our business. Whether it’s mobility, broadband, video, commercial, residential, L&I, MDU, or all; we are a one-stop solution to help sales partners uncover growth opportunities.
Our commitment to excellence drives us to harness the power of data and insights to make informed decisions and achieve remarkable outcomes. As a Business Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in translating data into meaningful stories that guide our business initiatives and fuel our growth.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with the data team and analyze relevant data sets to uncover valuable insights
Craft compelling narratives using data-driven insights to communicate the progress, outcomes, and ROI of various business initiatives
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports that provide clear and concise visualizations of key performance indicators (KPIs)
Join forces cross-functionally with teams including marketing, operations, and finance to gather data and insights to support decision-making
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities within the data to inform strategic planning and business optimization
Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented initiatives, making recommendations for improvements based on data analysis
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization
Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Data Science, or a related field highly preferred
Proven experience of 3 years in business analysis, data analysis, or a related role
Strong analytical mindset and the ability to derive insights from complex data sets
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., PowerPoint, Tableau, Power BI) to create compelling reports and dashboards
Excellent storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner
Strong project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines
Knowledge of Domo is a plus but not required
Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy in all aspects of work
Self-motivated and able to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment

Benefits

Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance are available on the first day of the month following your first day of employment – no extended waiting period!
401k Plan with employer matching
Paid vacation, personal/sick days, and bereavement time
DSI Bucks: Employee Profit-Sharing Program
50% AT&T wireless discount
Paid training

Operation Support Analyst

The Operations Support Analyst is a member of the Operations Support Team which has a primary responsibility in maintaining system availability. The Operations Support Analyst provides knowledge and skills in a multi-faceted environment of App Dev, DevOps, Networking, and Infrastructure (Mainframe/MidTier/Cloud). The Operations Support Analyst will use this expertise to facilitate root-cause analysis of problems to include the development of workarounds and/or permanent solutions, assist in change management coordination, and major incident support.

The entire Operations Support Team is required to assist in major incident recovery efforts. An Ops Support Analyst will be called upon to provide specific guidance on a problem root cause and the workarounds or permanent solution. They will also be required to assist coordinating change management activities under the guidance of the change manager.

The Ops Support Analyst will:


Assist the Problem Manager in data analysis and identify required participants (SME’s) from other groups



Use standard problem analysis techniques to facilitate identification and validation of the Root Cause



Collaborate with SME’s and Service Owners to:


o Facilitate development of Workarounds and short-term corrective actions for Known Errors

o Facilitate development and testing of permanent solution

o Record and update problem and Known Error records with appropriate information

o Assist the Problem Manager in validating that the Root Cause has been eliminated upon implementation of the recommended solution


Identify, develop, document, and recommend appropriate workarounds for Known Errors of unresolved problems determined to reside within the scope of the services



Perform Root Cause analysis


o Updating the Problem to a Known Error to assist with future Incident and Problem Investigation and diagnosis

o Analyzing the Root Cause of the Problem and updating the appropriate knowledge bases


Provide status reports detailing the Root Cause analysis of, and procedures for, correcting recurring Problems and critical device Severity Level Incidents



Facilitate a Solution plan


o Researching potential permanent solutions

o Developing permanent resolution plans for Problems

o Contacting other support groups to arrange for and schedule resources from other service areas to execute solution plan tasks

o Change documentation with recommended corrective actions to be taken to and submit to Change Management for review

o May also be called upon to help coordinate Change Management efforts

o Maintaining a link between the Problem Record and related Record for Change (RFC)


Update the Problem reporting system with the Root Cause, resolution, and the closure portion of the record, reviewing that the cause code reflects the actual cause of the Problem, and documentation is complete before closure by the Problem Analyst



Document Known Error Database with information regarding Problem resolution actions, activities and status and notifying all appropriate stakeholders of availability of information



Provide effective resolution to the Problem in accordance with the SLA/OLA



Tracking and reporting on Problems and trends or failures, and identifying associated consequences of Problems



Flexible work from home options available.

Job Description:
Are you passionate about patient care and helping people live active lives? Are you curious about what it means to create the next generation of medical technology and be part of a growing global company committed to Creating Better Together™?
At Enovis™ we sweat the little things. We embrace collaboration with our partners and patients, and we glory in the grind of scientific excellence — with the goal of transforming medical technology as we know it. Because that’s how we change the lives of patients for the better. And that’s how we create better together.
As a key member of the Sales Operations Team, you will play an integral part in reporting and analysis to support our Recovery Sciences (RS) and Bracings & Supports (BAS) Business Units.
We are seeking a dedicated and talented individual to join us as a Sales Operations Analyst I in our Lewisville, TX office. This is an incredible opportunity to work cross-functionally to drive analysis on internal/external data, competitive crosses, and market penetration.
WHY JOIN ENOVIS?
You’ll be part of a global team of more than 7,000 dedicated employees who are empowered to create better together every day on a worldwide scale.
You’ll make an impact in the lives of Healthcare Providers (HCPs), their patients, and the communities where we work.
You’ll enjoy a comprehensive and competitive benefits package including health benefits, 401(k) with company match, employee stock purchase program, tuition and CEU assistance, paid time off, a solid work/life balance and more!
You’ll have the opportunity to grow and develop your career with us.
You’ll work hard and have fun doing it!


WHAT WILL YOUR TYPICAL DAY LOOK LIKE?
Creates data quality metrics and reporting to validate and inform Market intelligence.
Compiles data from a variety of applications, systems, and sources to create/summarize for analysis.
Performs data analysis to solve business problems or service requests using SQL, Excel and similar tools.
Provides data consulting in support of both business byimproving sales performance, go-to-market (GTM) strategies, Master Data Management, and KPI management.
Builds, automates, maintains, and reports metrics and dashboards for various levels of leadership and teams across Sales, Marketing, and other functions.
Performs statistical, financial and/or operational analysis and modeling from data mining and presents findings, trends, or business recommendations.
Provides forward-looking analysis for BUs to gain insight on forecasting, business trends, and budgeting needs.
Other duties as assigned.

WHAT QUALIFICATIONS WILL YOU BRING TO THE TABLE?
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Finance, or related field required.
Minimum of 1 year of experience specifically related to data reporting/mining, business strategy, Sales Operations, or related field equivalent required.
Experience working cross-functionally among teams and business groups required.
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel (including Pivot Tables), MS Access, MS PowerPoint, ERP systems, CRM systems and database extraction required.
Experience working with data extraction tools through ERP platforms (e.g., Oracle, SAP, BaaN, etc.) required.
Knowledge of SQL, reporting tools, SalesForce.com, Data Warehousing, Power BI, and/or Birst strongly preferred.

ABOUT DJO GLOBAL
DJO Global is a leading global developer, manufacturer and distributor of high-quality medical devices that provide solutions for musculoskeletal health, vascular health and pain management. Our products address the continuum of patient care from injury prevention to rehabilitation after surgery, injury or from degenerative disease, enabling people to regain or maintain their natural motion. Our products are used by orthopedic specialists, spine surgeons, primary care physicians, pain management specialists, physical therapists, podiatrists, chiropractors, athletic trainers and other healthcare professionals. In addition, many of our medical devices and related accessories are used by athletes and patients for injury prevention and at-home physical therapy treatment. Product lines include rigid and soft orthopedic bracing, hot and cold therapy, bone growth stimulators, vascular therapy systems and compression garments, therapeutic shoes and inserts, electrical stimulators used for pain management and physical therapy products. Our surgical division offers a comprehensive suite of reconstructive joint products for the hip, knee and shoulder. Our products are marketed under a portfolio of brands including Aircast®, Chattanooga, CMF™, Compex®, DonJoy®, ProCare®, Exos™, Dr. Comfort®, DonJoy Performance® and DJO® Surgical.
For additional information on the Company, please visit www.DJOglobal.com.

GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION
Want to shape one of the most important and powerful elements of online purchasing for the heavy duty parts market leader? As a Digital Business Analyst, you will work day-to-day with cross-functional Product Development Teams, their Product Owners, and the hosting Organization. You will bring your experience, fresh ideas, and creative thinking to help the team create amazing digital products (mobile & web). You will focus on creating Business Value, amazing User Experience, and exceptional Product Quality.
This is a strategic role for FleetPride and will require skillful balance of machine learning and data science, a sharp customer-first eye, and strong cross-functional collaboration across all business channels.
As a Product Owner - Search, You Will
Deliver world-class on-site search experiences that address customer and prospect needs and drive business value
Constantly look for ways we can use search to set us apart from the competition, driving new and enhanced functionality to make the shopping experience easy and convenient.
Work collaboratively with internal partners, key stakeholders, and external vendor partners to identify and enable priority use cases.
Define metrics that inform the success of search initiatives, monitor performance in real time, and determine a product roll-out strategy based on quantitative and user feedback.
Improve the accuracy and precision of site search, optimize via machine learning, and serve relevant results quickly.
Hands on, data driven individuals who aren’t afraid to open the hood and get it done
EDUCATION & TRAINING
Bachelor degree in business or related field or equivalent experience in Business or related field
KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE
2-5 years of experience as a Business Analyst, Product Owner, or Product Manager
Digitally savvy, with a passion for innovative and quality digital products
Experience in Digital Product or Services Development (Mobile or Web)
Entrepreneurial mindset, with a bias toward action and customer focused innovation. You thrive on challenges and not be deterred by difficult situations. You work proactively rather than reactively.
Demonstrated ability to work as part of a cross-functional team and willingness to take on responsibilities outside primary job description when necessary
Hands on experience with Google Analytics, PowerBI and Excel
SKILLS & ABILITIES
Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills; willingness to get into the details and drive clarity from ambiguity.
Support the product vision and roadmap from ideation, product requirements gathering, and delivery.
Strong data analytics and A/B testing knowledge for consumer and platform products
Ability to employ a variety of qualitative and quantitative analysis techniques to continually improve the user experience.
Run user to ensure high product quality.
Analyze and monitor the market and the competition.
Participate in ideation sessions for new Products or Functionalities
Contribute to the Product community, by sharing knowledge and energy.

FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement technical solutions
- Conduct system testing and debugging to ensure functionality and performance

- Programming skills in Python for data analysis and automation tasks
- Experience with analytics tools for data visualization and reporting
- Understanding of database design principles and SQL for querying and manipulating data
- Knowledge of VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) for automating tasks in Microsoft Office suite

This role requires a strong technical aptitude, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technology, a desire to continuously learn and improve their skills, and the ability to effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

If you are looking for an opportunity to contribute to the success of a dynamic organization while expanding your technical expertise, we encourage you to apply.

Job Title: Lead Specialist – IT Project Management - Dallas, TX - 2310003095
Job Description:
Summary:

We are seeking an experienced IT Project Manager with a background in Business Analysis to join our dynamic team. This role requires a unique blend of technical expertise and business acumen, making it an exciting opportunity for individuals who thrive in a fast-paced, innovative environment who enjoy working with their customers. Strong leadership, strategic thinking, excellent problem-solving skills and exceptional communication skills will be needed to be successful in this role.

This position comes with world class compensation, benefits, 401(k) match, profit sharing, and PTO.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Manage and oversee projects from conception to completion, ensuring they are completed within time and budget constraints.
Oversee and manage the seamless integration of business acquisitions to include coordinating with various teams to ensure the successful transition and integration of systems, processes, and personnel; identify potential risks and challenges, developing mitigation strategies; and ensuring that the integration aligns with the overall strategic objectives of the organization.
Develop detailed project plans and monitor progress, adjusting as needed.
Conduct risk management to minimize project risks.
Use business analysis skills to improve systems and processes.
Translate business needs into technical requirements.
Facilitate communication between the IT team and business stakeholders.
Prepare and present progress reports to stakeholders.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in IT, Business, or related field
Proven experience as an IT Project Manager, preferably with experience in managing large system integrations.
Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Certification in Project Management (PMP) or Business Analysis (CBAP).
Experience in Agile/Scrum methodologies.

The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

Position:Full-Time

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. The Company brings together the complementary expertise of two industry pioneers, one in advanced lens technologies and the other in the craftsmanship of iconic eyewear, to create a vertically integrated business that is uniquely positioned to address the world’s evolving vision needs and the global demand of a growing eyewear industry.


With over 180,000 dedicated employees in 150 countries driving our iconic brands, our people are creative, entrepreneurial and celebrated for their unique perspectives and individuality. Committed to vision, we enable people to “see more and be more” thanks to our innovative designs and lens technologies, exceptional quality and cutting-edge processing methods. Every day we impact the lives of millions by changing the way people see the world.


Our unique business model and relentless pursuit of operational excellence ensures that consumers everywhere have access to products. Balancing speed, efficiency and proximity, the Company manages a global supply chain with cutting-edge technology, based on centralization for frames and on a capillary network for lens finishing and prescription laboratories. Greasing the wheels behind the scenes, our people in Operations are the backbone of our Company.
GENERAL FUNCTION
Work as part of a team responsible for systems support and improvements that will increase profitability, efficiency and flexibility of the ELOA lab network. Work with the Lab Team Leaders within Regions to create an environment of trust where systems, developments and enhancements are adopted and integrated into current working practices, and where systems and technologies are fully utilized. Provide systems support, know-how, and technical expertise to support Lab goals and imperatives and maximize system improvement opportunities.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work to achieve subject matter expert level in:
Optifacts LMS & other lab applications deployed
Systems reporting capabilities


Support Lab Team Leaders within Regions to meet Operational Excellence objectives defined below through the utilization of current systems and the deployment of systems improvements and new functionalities:
Service – Turn-time, Service Level, & Late Jobs
Quality – Breakage & Redo’s
Unit Cost – Finishing, Coating, Transportation


Continuous Improvement
Ensure a well maintained and robust environment that meets current and future business needs by identifying areas of opportunity for Continuous Improvement.
Preparation of functional requirements that will deliver Lab defined enhancements to meet business needs
Define and capture the metrics to measure the impact and success of these improvements


Project Support
Gather user requirements needed for new systems evaluation.
Participate in the definition, evaluation, development, and deployment of new systems solutions to ELOA Lab network.
Process mapping to identify potential impact and risk areas.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field
Dedication to improving the performance of EOA Labs through effective information delivery
Knowledge of the Lens Rx business (Recommended)
Solid data mining skills
Business Intelligence experience in data collection, management, and metrics deployment
Outstanding verbal, written, and communication skills in both business and IS environments


Employee pay is determined by multiple factors, including geography, experience, qualifications, skills and local minimum wage requirements. In addition, you may also be offered a competitive bonus and/or commission plan, which complements a first-class total rewards package Benefits/Incentive Information including health benefits, PTO, 401K, paid family leave, tuition reimbursement, and eyewear discounts.


Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, EssilorLuxottica will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities who need assistance in the application and hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call the Luxottica Ethics Compliance Hotline at 1-888-887-3348 (be sure to provide your name and contact information so that we may follow up in a timely manner) or email HRCompliance@luxotticaretail.com.

Native Americans receive preference in accordance with Tribal Law.

Job Title: Strategic Business Analyst II (Hybrid - Coppell, TX)
Job Description:
About Blackhawk Network:
Blackhawk Network (BHN) is the leader in global branded payment technologies. We strengthen relationships between brands and their customers, employees, and partners by transforming transactions into connections. BHN’s portfolio includes: Gift Card & eGift products, promotions and distribution that grow revenue faster; Rewards & Incentives that build loyalty and acquisition and are integrated into today’s leading platforms; and Payments that enable businesses and customers to access and disburse funds in convenient and innovative ways. BHN’s network spans across the globe with over 400,000 consumer touchpoints. Learn more at BHN.com.
Overview:
As the Business Analyst, you will be responsible for supporting the strategy, design and governance of sales analytics and insights. You will partner closely with Sales, Finance, Marketing, BI teams, and business unit leaders to provide executive management tools and insights to better inform business decisions. This role will be responsible for supporting wholistic sales analytics, dashboard reporting, and supporting a wide range of projects that impact the BHN Sales and Marketing teams.
Responsibilities:
This is a highly visible role and great opportunity to support both Sales and Global Revenue Operations leadership as you will focus on driving the global success of the business analytics organization. Duties are as follows:
Support the design, implementation, and administration of sales metric and KPI reporting
Establish relationships with Sales and Operations leaders in various business units and customer segments to understand complex business drivers and interactions
Identify business and process issues, translate them into business requirements and metrics, evaluate solutions, and roll out system launches and integration
Work jointly with business partners to ensure accuracy in showing full end-to-end insights of the sales process and customer journey
Build strong working partnerships with internal resources including Field Sales Management, Finance, Marketing, and BI teams.
Support development of key business presentations
Proactively conceptualize, design, and execute initiatives based on business needs
Support the development of both executive leadership and sales executive level reporting on behalf of multiple sales business units
Provide support in preparation and management of quarterly business reviews, board reviews, and quarterly sales team readouts to leadership
Qualifications:
BA/BS Degree required
Minimum of 2+ years experience in a business analytics role, Sales analytics and operations a plus
A proven record of success as an individual contributor or team manager
Experience of impacting business growth through personal contribution to specific initiatives
Best practice business intelligence principles and discipline
Experience with KPI creation, financial analysis and budgeting, building data models, and transformation projects
Strong analytical and data-driven mindset for problem solving and decision-making
Project multitasking while working autonomously and part of team
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability influence outcomes
EEO Statement:
Blackhawk Network provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Blackhawk Network believes that diversity leads to strength. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Blackhawk Network encourages applicants with previous criminal records to apply to all positions and, pursuant to the San Francisco and Los Angeles Fair Chance Acts (and other “Fair Chance” laws), Blackhawk Network will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Job Details

Description

Description

The DC Operations Analyst will be responsible for working in a team environment, completing assigned tasks, retaining information and building knowledge in the field. As knowledge about the field increases, responsibilities and tasks will grow, up to and including all aspects of record keeping, systems and processes.




Who We Are

Independent for 75 years, Milliman delivers market-leading services and solutions to clients worldwide. Today, we are helping companies take on some of the world’s most critical and complex issues, including retirement funding and healthcare financing, risk management and regulatory compliance, data analytics and business transformation.




Through a team of professionals ranging from actuaries to clinicians, technology specialists to plan administrators, we offer unparalleled expertise in employee benefits, investment consulting, healthcare, life insurance and financial services, and property and casualty insurance.




What You Will Do

Gain full understanding of clients and their plans to proactively manage accounts
Gain and develop thorough understanding of IRS regulations and plan documents
Gain and develop skills necessary to interpret the plan document and regulations applicable to administering qualified retirement plans.
Gain and develop proficiency in industry software applications, databases and spreadsheets.
Data input and processing of plan transactions.
Respond to client and participant inquiries in a timely fashion an ensure workflow items are completed/delivered timely as well



Who We Are Looking For

Required Experience and Skills

2-5+ years of industry experience with an expertise in retirement plans and strong working knowledge of 401(k) plans

Preferred Qualifications

QKA certification

Personal Qualifications

Works well within a team environment and takes ownership of personal work product.
Proficiency in the use of computers and other general office equipment.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
Attention to detail.
Excellent problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills (both written and verbal).
Able to productively respond to change.
Excellent organization and time management skills.



Location

This role is based out of the Milliman office in Dallas, TX, but candidates hired into this role may work remotely anywhere in the US.




Compensation

The salary range for this role is $50,000 to $96,000, depending on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, education, relevant work experience, qualifications, skills, certifications, location, etc.




Benefits

At Milliman, we focus on creating an environment that recognizes – and meets – the personal and professional needs of the individual and their family. We offer competitive benefits which include the following based on plan eligibility:

Medical, dental and vision coverage for employees and their dependents, including domestic partners
A 401(k) plan with matching program, and profit sharing contribution
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
A discretionary bonus program
Paid Time Off (PTO) starts accruing on the first day of work and can be used for any reason; full-time employees will accrue 15 days of PTO per year, and employees working less than a full-time schedule will accrue PTO at a prorated amount based on hours worked
Family building benefits, including adoption and fertility assistance and paid parental leave up to 12 weeks for employees who have worked for Milliman for at least 12 months and have worked at least 1,250 hours in the preceding 12-month period
A minimum of 8 paid holidays
Milliman covers 100% of the premiums for life insurance, AD&D, and both short-term and long-term disability coverage
Flexible spending accounts allow employees to set aside pre-tax dollars to pay for dependent care, transportation, and applicable medical needs



Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.
Key Accountabilities
Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.
Assembling business requirements with requisite analysis and translation into D365 solutions; along with alternative options and recommendations.
Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Job Title: SQL Developer / Data Conversion Specialist / Business Analyst
Job Description:
D.R. Horton, Inc., the largest homebuilder in the U.S., was founded in 1978 and is a publicly traded company on the New York Stock Exchange. It is engaged in the construction and sale of high quality homes designed principally for the entry-level and first time move-up markets. The Company also provides mortgage financing and title services for homebuyers through its mortgage and title subsidiaries. Please visit our website at www.drhorton.com for more information.




D.R. Horton, Inc. is currently looking for a SQL Developer / Data Conversion Specialist / Business Analyst. The right candidate will be responsible for creation of web base applications using one or more of the following technologies: MVC, Microsoft technologies (C#, Entity Framework), React, JavaScript/CSS, WebAPI, SQL Databases and other web development technologies.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Develop applications that streamline internal business processes
Work with existing legacy applications to convert (if necessary), extend and enhance functionality, as well as developing new applications
Perform unit testing after completion of the development tasks, initiate end to end testing and validation in a development environment
Follow the pre-defined development standards for naming conventions, user interface, etc.
Work on assigned tasks to completion, correctly and in assigned time
Perform problem determination for correcting defects
Assist Software Development Manager or Software Development Team Lead in designing solutions for enhancements or during problem resolution
Complete estimates as to how much work is involved for all the project tasks, and perform analysis to determine how the solution can be achieved with the best design solution
May work with users or Business Analysts to determine requirements and design for systems
Conducts all business in a professional and ethical manner to serve customers and increase the goodwill and profit of the company
May support miscellaneous legacy systems


Qualifications


Education and/or Experience

Excel experience
Fluent in SQL development
Basic knowledge of accounting systems
Working knowledge of SSRS - Microsoft Reporting Services
Basic knowledge of SSAS – Microsoft Analysis Services
Working knowledge of SSIS – Microsoft Integration Services
Working knowledge of SSMS – Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio
Working knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio
Working knowledge of IBM DB2 a plus
Basic knowledge of MYSQL
Basic knowledge of PowerBI
Basic understanding of CDC mirroring and SQL replication or similar
Ability to work with end users to identify and troubleshoot problems
Ability to design and implement conversion strategies to bring data from non DRH databases into company databases
Experience with other Homebuilder software (ECI Mark Systems, Sage Timberline, Builder MT, etc) preferred
Real estate homebuilding experience preferred
Experience with JDEdwards World Homebuilder Modules preferred



Come join a winning team with a Fortune 500 company! We are growing fast and are looking for enthusiastic attitudes and team players to join our success. We offer an excellent benefits package including:




Medical, Vision and Dental
401(K)
Employee Stock Purchase Plan
Flex Spending Accounts
Life Insurance
Vacation, Sick, Personal Time and Company Holidays



Build YOUR future with D.R. Horton, America’s Builder. #WEBUILDPEOPLETOO
