Job Title: Business Insight Analyst II (Remote based in the US)
Job Description:
As a part of the Tenet and Catholic Health Initiatives family, Conifer Health brings 30 years of healthcare industry expertise to clients in more than 135 local regions nationwide. We help our clients strengthen their financial and clinical performance, serve their communities, and succeed at the business of healthcare. Conifer Health helps organizations transition from volume to value-based care, enhance the consumer and patient healthcare experience and improve quality, cost and access to healthcare. Are you ready to be part of our solutions? Welcome to the company that gives you the resources and incentives to redefine healthcare services, with a competitive benefits package and leadership to take your career to the next step!

JOB SUMMARY

Intermediate-level Analyst to prepare monthly, daily, weekly and ad hoc reports that will allow the business unit to analyze and improve business performance. May have oversight of Analyst I.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Others may be assigned.

Independently clarifies report needs with clients to understand the purpose and content of request, utilizes systems to create and deliver analysis to meet client’s needs, audits and analyzes data to verify quality and data integrity. Points out and research data anomalies.
Meets user deadlines for ad hoc reports and other requested information. Provide suggestions and recommendations to perform the necessary analytics to ensure requests are complete and accurate.
Learns new technologies and systems to advance knowledge of reporting and analysis
Builds relationships with other revenue cycle unit managers and supervisors to ensure good working relationships between other units and Analytics.
Completes daily/weekly/monthly reporting assignments and strives for accuracy
Works independently and with little supervision; prioritizes and manages multiple tasks to meet deadlines; and seeks guidance from manager as needed to clarify assignments or requests, ask questions, or seek additional information.
Serves as a resource to Analyst I and other analysts and provides information and
training as required.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Displays a desire to learn, understand processes, and reach the next level
Excellent communication, customer service and time-management skills
Good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with other team members and customers.
Respectful of all levels.
Position requires basic business skills, an understanding of general financial operations
and major AR goals in the healthcare environment.
Can make logical correlations between data points to determine if analysis is accurate.
Strong analytical skills that review, interpret, summarize, and make recommendations to clients
Set up and facilitate meetings with client and multiple business units in order to address business needs and develop solutions
Gather business requirements from client to design analytical strategy for reporting
Ability to demonstrate strong prioritization of projects and manage multiple deadlines
Proficient (medium to high skill level) with various desktop applications such as Microsoft
Excel, Word, PowerPoint and/or Access.

We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.

Bell Flight has an opening in our Fort Worth, TX headquarters for an experienced Business Process Controls Analyst to work with Govt auditors and perform internal audits of defense contractor business systems. This position will report to the Sr. Manager of Business Process Controls and will interface with Bell Flight, Textron Aviation Defense, and Textron Corporate personnel as well as the US Government (USG).

In this role, you will be responsible for assisting in ensuring business system compliance to USG Federal Acquisition Regulations Systems for Defense Contracts at Bell and Textron Aviation Defense locations as well as documenting and supporting compliance with Textron processes related to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), and Cost Accounting Standards (CAS).

Primary Responsibilities:

Perform business system reviews at Bell and Textron Aviation Defense in accordance with DFARS 252.242-7005.
Support various Bell business units, as well as Textron Aviation Defense, with USG audits of business systems, incurred cost submissions, forward pricing rates, and all other USG audits.
Assist Bell, Textron Aviation Defense, and Textron Corporate with maintaining CAS Disclosure Statements.
Assist in the continuous evaluation of compliance with CAS and other regulatory requirements.
Help in the preparation of any required General Dollar Magnitudes (GDM) to quantify accounting changes or respond to USG audit reports.
Support requests for information from DCAA, DCMA and other USG agencies.
Review USG audit reports and assist in developing robust responses.
Foster positive relationships and establish frequent, consistent, reliable communication with DCMA, DCAA, NAVAIR, NAS, AMCOM, AFPRO. Establish and maintain working relationships and open communications with all relevant internal and external personnel.
Will travel up to 10-15% plus as needed to support audits for Bell and Textron Aviation Defense (US Domestic).


Educational Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or similar field.

Position Requirements:

2+ years of experience in Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A), Accounting, Finance, or similar field.
Strong computer skills are required with a focus on Microsoft products (Excel, Word, Power Point).
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong presentation skills.
Ability to travel up to 10-15% plus to support business process controls audits for DCAA, DCMA and other USG agencies.

Preferred Skills and Experience:

Prior experience with auditing DFARS government business systems.
Knowledge of government contracting requirements.
Familiar with the roles of DCAA, DCMA and other USG agencies in auditing business processes for compliance to federal defense contracts regulations.
Knowledge of the FAR, DFARS and Cost Accounting Standards and how the regulations apply to various businesses.

About the Role

The BI Analyst plays a crucial role in analyzing business data, creating reports, and developing dashboards that help make data-driven decisions.


A Day in the Life

Make a significant impact on our business decisions by providing valuable insights through data analysis of large datasets.
Collaborate with various departments within the company to identify and analyze areas of potential revenue growth.
Provide analytical insights (quantitative and qualitative) from internal and external datasets to support business function decisions.
Develop and maintain KPIs, scheduled reports, dashboards and reporting for data integrity.
Clearly and precisely present complex information and viable recommendations to stakeholders, including the C-Suite; translate data into actionable insights.
Collect and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights to drive business objectives.
Develop and implement statistical models to solve business problems.
Collaborate with relevant EWC departments to understand their data needs, provide recommendations to improve processes, and drive growth with data-based decision-making.
Identify opportunities to implement predictive analytics and machine learning algorithms to drive decision-making.
Develop and implement research methodologies to inform/enhance data-driven business decisions.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging trends in analytics and data science.


What Sets You Apart

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Self-starter with a proven ability to facilitate corporate data-driven decision capabilities using effective data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large data sets and experience visualizing them.
Ability to investigate data to explain anomalies, troubleshoot issues and partner with the business teams as needed.
Demonstrated ability to manage analytical projects from requirement gathering to presentation and reporting.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and how to apply them to large datasets.
Knowledge of earned value management, cost-benefit, what-if, project performance, and business project analysis.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations, plus has the ability to translate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, information mgmt.., etc.).
3+ years of proven proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Power BI, Looker); creating impactful dashboards.
3+ years of retail or service-base Franchise data analysis.

The City of Fort Worth is one of the fastest growing large cities in the U.S. Our employees serve the needs of nearly 1,000,000 residents, promoting our values of exceptional customer experience, mutual respect, embracing our diversity, continuous improvement, ethical behavior, and accountability.

A Sr. Court Business Systems Analyst position is available with the City of Fort Worth Municipal Court Services Department in our Administrative Services division. The successful incumbent will report directly to the Municipal Court Services Director. This position will specifically manage the court case management systems and other court technology projects having significant information technology components.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Business Administration, Public Administration, or related field.
Five or more years of business experience and business analysis experience.
Valid Texas driver's license.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience managing court technology systems and projects, and enhancing court centric data systems. (Equivant CourtView, NetDMS, QLess, For The Record (FTR) etc.)
Federal, Municipal, State, or local government experience.
Three (3) or more years of supervisory and project management experience.

The Sr. Court Business Systems Analyst job responsibilities include:

Supervise staff, as assigned, which includes prioritizing and assigning work; conducting performance evaluations; ensuring staff is trained; ensuring employees follow policies and procedures; maintaining a healthy and safe working environment; and, making hiring, termination, and disciplinary decisions or recommendations.
Work with stakeholders to define and document court case management system support boundaries.
Perform internal desktop support for case management system issues and provide resolution.
Analyze information to assess issues and risks; then define alternatives related to case management support.
Conduct case management business process reengineering related to change orders.
Manages department use of application modules and provides user administration such as add/change/delete permissions (role) assignment.
Use and/or troubleshoot related hardware and software. (Equivant CourtView, NetDMS, etc.)
Perform quality assurance and controls data integrity.
Track and oversee the procurement process for software and/or hardware and is responsible for department inventory.

Working Conditions

Applicants for this position must pass a Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) fingerprint-based background check and maintain CJIS eligibility. Due to CJIS requirements related to system access, the following will result in being disqualified for this position: Felony Convictions, Felony Deferred Adjudication, Class A Misdemeanor Conviction, Class B Misdemeanor Convictions in the last 10 years, Class A Misdemeanor Deferred Adjudication, Class B Misdemeanor Deferred Adjudication in the last 10 years, an Open Arrest for Any Criminal Offense (Felony or Misdemeanor), and ALL Family Violence Convictions regardless of class.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. 100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents

20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care

At True Velocity, the possibilities are limitless and so is the greatness of our team members. We are seeking creative, open-minded, and enthusiastic individuals to join our team. We have an opening for an Database Administrator and Power BI Analyst to join our growing team.


Job Summary: We are seeking a skilled and experienced Database Administrator and Power BI Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for the creation, maintenance, and support of Oracle and SQL databases, with a focus on generating custom Manufacturing Operations Reports using Microsoft Power BI. Your primary responsibilities will include:


Essential Functions:
Database Administration:


Design and implement Oracle and SQL databases to support various business functions, with a strong focus on manufacturing operations data.
Monitor and maintain the health, security, and performance of the databases, ensuring data integrity and availability.
Perform database backups, restores, and disaster recovery planning to minimize downtime.


Data Analysis and Reporting:
Develop custom reports and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI to visualize manufacturing data and key performance indicators (KPIs).
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their reporting needs and provide actionable insights through data visualization.
Create stored procedures, triggers, and functions in Oracle and SQL to support report data extraction.
Data Integration and ETL:


Implement data integration processes, extract, transform, and load (ETL) to consolidate data from various sources into the databases.

Description


Salary Range:

Salary commensurate with experience and qualifications

About SMU

SMU’s more than 12,000 diverse, high-achieving students come from all 50 states and over 80 countries to take advantage of the University’s small classes, meaningful research opportunities, leadership development, community service, international study and innovative programs.

SMU serves approximately 7,000 undergraduates and 5,000 graduate students through eight degree-granting schools: Dedman College of Humanities and Sciences, Cox School of Business, Lyle School of Engineering, Meadows School of the Arts, Simmons School of Education and Human Development, Dedman School of Law, Perkins School of Theology and Moody School of Graduate and Advanced Studies.

SMU is data driven, and its powerful supercomputing ecosystem – paired with entrepreneurial drive – creates an unrivaled environment for the University to deliver research excellence.

Now in its second century of achievement, SMU is recognized for the ways it supports students, faculty and alumni as they become ethical, enterprising leaders in their professions and communities. SMU’s relationship with Dallas – the dynamic center of one of the nation’s fastest-growing regions – offers unique learning, research, social and career opportunities that provide a launch pad for global impact.

SMU is nonsectarian in its teaching and committed to academic freedom and open inquiry.

About the Department:

Development and External Affairs (DEA) supports SMU by securing funding for University priorities; by promoting meaningful involvement in the life and work of the University; by heightening international, national, state and local awareness of SMU; and by supporting the enrollment of a diverse and able student body.

DEA comprises the offices of Office of the Vice President, Annual Giving and Alumni Relations, Development Services, Program Services and Donor Relations, Marketing and Communications, Principal and Major Gifts, and School and Project Development.

SMU continues to leverage the benefits from the largest fund-raising campaign in its history to achieve dramatic increases in academic quality and impact.

About the Position:

This role is an on-campus, in-person position.

The Department Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and maintaining data automation processes for the
Blackbaud CRM donor/alumni database (BBEC) and the PeopleSoft Campus Solutions student system (My.SMU),
ensuring data integrity, and accessibility to support Development and External Affairs initiatives.

This role serves as the primary resource for bulk updates of constituent records from various sources via designated tasks and special data augmentation and import projects. The Department Business Systems Analyst will also analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve workflow processes and audit reports.

This position reports directly to the Assistant Director of Constituent Records, who oversees overall data integrity in
Blackbaud CRM.

Essential Functions:

Manage constituent data and data upload automation processes including management of the existing bridge
between PeopleSoft Campus Solutions and Blackbaud CRM, oversight and assignment of mass upload requests.




Respond to and execute mass-change requests including biographic/demographic information, academic data, solicit
codes, life changes, and more from on-line forms, SMU Network (Alumni Directory), NCOA, AlumniFinder, My.SMU,
and critical "new parents" data ingestion process using required MS Access skills.




Create and maintain data integration tools and perform necessary modifications, documenting work-flow processes.
Evaluate and streamline processes as necessary and communicate with leadership as needed for maintenance of
processes and/or creation of new processes.




Create, prioritize and track special projects to meet deadlines in partnership with Project Management office. Projects
may involve simple updates, complex updates, research, analytical thought, and problem resolution skills as well as other responsibilities. Assist Assistant Director and Director with managing collaborative projects.




Participate in scheduled testing in both BBEC and My.SMU relating to patches, upgrades and enhancements.




Propose problem resolution and provide insight to supervisor and customers as needed; work with the Assistant
Director of Constituent Records to set systems and document procedures; general auditing of data on a scheduled
and as needed basis in partnership with Quality Assurance Specialist.




Ongoing data maintenance responsibilities.



Qualifications


Education and Experience:

A high school diploma or equivalent and nine years full-time work experience is required.




OR

A Bachelor's degree and five years of full-time work experience.

A minimum of two years of work experience in a data management role is also required.

Work experience in data automation and/or data validation preferred. Experience in non-profit or higher education desired.




Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Candidate must demonstrate strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills, with the ability to develop and maintain effective relationships with a wide range of constituencies. Must also demonstrate strong written communication skills. A strong customer service orientation is essential.




Candidate must possess strong problem-solving skills with the ability to identify and analyze problems, as well as devise solutions. Must also be able to assess and troubleshoot existing workflow processes and implement appropriate solutions as needed.

Candidate must have strong organizational, planning, and time management skills. The ability to work independently within a team environment and meet department goals and deadlines is required.




Candidate must have a strong working knowledge of MS Access and MS Excel is required. Must be able to troubleshoot and modify existing MS Access databases. An aptitude for data analysis and analytical thinking in approaching data challenges is essential.

Candidate must also have a working knowledge of relational databases and familiarity with data transformation. The ability to troubleshoot and resolve issues like database performance, database capacity, replication, and other data-related issues is essential.

VBA knowledge is desirable. Experience with PeopleSoft and Blackbaud CRM is preferred. ETL Developer Skills including Debugging/Problem Solving, ability to collaborate with other IT teams to modify and enhance existing BI assets is a plus.

Physical and Environmental Demands:

Sit for long periods of time

Ability to work at a desk and at a computer for extended periods of time

December 15, 2023




Priority consideration may be given to submissions received by December 8, 2023.

The the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is looking for a Shopping and Pricing Subject Matter Expert - Airlines; to be able to understand the technical and functional complexity of Shopping and Pricing software system, provide expertise and premium assistance to airlines and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. The mission of the Search, Shopping and Pricing division is to offer travel search and travel solution pricing expertise to major customers such as Expedia, Kayak, Southwest, Air Canada and Delta. Our scalable platform is massively distributed, and integrated to the huge Amadeus ecosystem managing massive traffic daily. We are offering a large panel of products and integrated solutions orchestrating flows and providing assistance to the customer on the entire end-to-end process of search for a flight solution, tailor and price it, book and issue the ticket, including the possibility of repricing and reissuance for a change of journey. Southwest and Hawaiian airlines are major customers in the region and we need a technical business analyst able to understand the technical and functional complexity of this software ecosystem, provide expertise and premium assistance to them and manage internal communication with other divisions and with customer. In this role you'll:

Act as primary entry point in areas requiring expertise
For transversal solution escalation points

solutions

Product Management

Product Management at Capital One is a booming, vibrant craft that requires reimagining the status quo, finding value creation opportunities, and driving innovative and sustainable customer experiences through technology.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you


In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 years of product management experience or at least 3 years of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Job Description:

As a Sr. Business Analyst for the WO Payment Suite, you will empower our customers' finance teams to enhance cash flow performance, reduce DSO and accelerate collections by designing, refining, and optimizing the accounts receivable workflows of media companies. Additionally, you will collaborate with our customers' agencies to enhance their workflows as part of our broader process improvement initiatives.

To be successful in this role, you'll leverage your expertise in fintech, foster partnerships, and work collectively with customers, as well as our Product and Development Teams. Jointly, you'll solve customer business challenges through activities such as defining requirements, guiding software enhancements, influencing development directions, and meticulously documenting customers' specific issues.

If you thrive on taking a consultative approach with customers, are enthusiastic about contributing to a rapidly expanding product line, and pride yourself on your exceptional organizational and attention-to-detail skills, then this opportunity may be the perfect fit for you.




Here is what success will look like:

Be the product champion and build effective relationships with key stakeholders
Partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Development teams to build a product which users love, and drive revenue for the business
Demonstrate proficiency in the product you are presenting and provide a thorough discussion of its functionality
Continuously keep the Sales team informed about the ongoing developments in the Payments Suite product and conduct product demonstrations for potential customers
Effectively handle support cases initiated by customers to address issues promptly and leverage the insights gained from these cases to enhance and advance the WO Payments Suite product
Assist in the pricing assessment for payment processor services offered to customers using designated software
Effectively manage multiple projects simultaneously and unassisted, adeptly managing changes in scope and/or timelines to ensure alignment with both client and product deadlines
Actively engage in meetings by providing thoughtful ideas to upcoming projects and contributing to the overall success of the product
Engage in consultative discussions with customers, leveraging your critical thinking skills and subject matter expertise to understand their obstacles related to WO Payments Suite software functionality
Collect and meticulously document customer requirements for new or modified features from diverse sources and conduct market research to assess current software demands and subsequently, define features that effectively address these needs
Communicate roadblocks and problems before customer satisfaction is negatively impacted
Exhibit leadership, professionalism and preparedness when communicating with team members, as well as internal and external customers
Develop positive working relationships within other departments in the organization to meet product goals and team expectations
Coordinate with Tech Writers to ensure documentation is accurate and comprehensible
Stay current with the latest developments and emerging trends in the fintech industry, exploring opportunities to apply them to our platform in ways that can significantly benefit our clients



To thrive in this role, we're looking for:

5+ years of experience in finance-focused business operations and analysis, within the media industry is advantageous
Experience and knowledge in finance, particularly in the context of payment processing and the operational intricacies of finance teams within medium-sized and large media companies, such as Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable (AP), or Credit and Collections (C&C), is highly valuable
Proven ability to work successfully as part of a team while also assuming individual obligations
Possess exceptional written communication and product demonstration skills, along with the capability to effectively translate customer requirements into professional user story documents
Exhibit a professional demeanor, communicating in a thoughtful and consultative way with internal and external customers
Proven ability to direct and manage multiple projects while staying organized and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent sense of judgment and decision-making skills
Familiarity with product management and the software lifecycle, encompassing the knowledge of the steps involved in transitioning a product from its initial design phase to successful launch

Boeing Global Services (BGS) is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Plano, TX.

This role will help business leaders to make smarter talent decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies to create reporting solutions, dashboards, and automate metrics across the digital strategy and experience (eCommerce) functions.

The ability to turn manual data processing into automated processing is critical. In addition, you will partner with internal customers, asking the right questions to understand requirement details and ensure accurate reporting. Success within this role hinges on the establishing strong working relationships with stakeholders, understanding existing data, and developing solutions that will enhance visibility of key performance indicators (KPIs).

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms. They will also have a strong business intuition and clear expertise in analyses; the ability to describe analytic processes including when and why specific approaches are favored.

Position Responsibilities:

Leads in designing complex Business Intelligence information models, dashboards, metrics and reports utilizing standard technologies and methodologies that meet business objectives
Assesses current technology for best fit
Combines programming, best practices, and business expertise to deliver efficient and scalable business intelligence solutions to improve productivity and business outcomes.
Distills large datasets into effective visualizations for executive reporting through data-analytics/visualization applications and languages (SQL, Python/R, and Tableau)
Develops multiple dashboards for interactive metrics
Leads data exploration within datasets to develop metrics supporting leadership decision making
Partners with multi-functional stakeholders across the business (analytics, information technology, execution, customer success and finance) to help define requirements, extract and compile data, develop optimized performance reporting, and drive business insight
Discovers new opportunities and solutions for problems by looking beyond current practices and using innovative thinking
Defines, designs, plans and manages projects
Controls and delivers project deliverables, project accounting and appraisal, and optimizes the contribution of the people involved
Works independently as well as collaboratively with team members to complete requirements from stakeholders

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):

5+ years of experience performing statistical analysis or using predictive modeling
5+ years of experience in database management, programming, statistical modeling and/or machine learning (SQL, R, Python, Tableau, etc.)
5+ years of experience in ETL (extract-transform-load)
5+ years of experience building intuitive and useful data visualizations that drive business decisions

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

Experience collaborating across organizational boundaries and delivering an integrated final product
Excellent interpersonal, written, and presentation skills, high-impact communication style

Typical Education/Experience:
Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience, 13 years' related work experience, etc.).

Company Overview
Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. The company ignites the passions of global sports fans and maximizes the presence and reach for hundreds of sports partners globally by offering innovative products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans, a global partner network with over 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, teams, players associations, athletes, celebrities, colleges, and college conferences, and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail business stores.
As a market leader with more than 18,000 employees, and hundreds of partners, suppliers, and vendors worldwide, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work, and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

Structure solutions to operational challenges by documenting processes, defining new KPIs and metrics, and creating data workflows

Collate & summarize business reports and create presentations to effectively communicate with a variety of audiences (peers, Ops leadership, external partners)
The ideal candidate:
2+ years of experience in strategy and/or data analytics

Comfortable working cross-functionally to brainstorm, collaborate, and influence decisions

Strong attention to detail, and the ability manage multiple priorities and communicate status
Experience with SQL, querying languages, and coding are a plus

Job Description:
As a part of the Tenet and Catholic Health Initiatives family, Conifer Health brings 30 years of healthcare industry expertise to clients in more than 135 local regions nationwide. We help our clients strengthen their financial and clinical performance, serve their communities and succeed at the business of healthcare. Conifer Health helps organizations transition from volume to value-based care, enhance the consumer and patient healthcare experience and improve quality, cost and access to healthcare. Are you ready to be part of our solutions? Welcome to the company that gives you the resources and incentives to redefine healthcare services, with a competitive benefits package and leadership to take your career to the next step!

JOB SUMMARY

This position will focus on the development and streamlining of business performance reports that aid operational Product Lines to make objective decisions. This position will identify improvement opportunities and communicate analysis results directly with Product Line leaders to assist with business performance advancement. Will independently lead projects related to revenue cycle operations initiative reporting, pre-integration client reporting, emerging client integration reporting and projects requiring expertise across multiple business reporting areas. This individual leverages analytical skills and time management skills to ensure that all requirements are accomplished within established timeframes. The Analyst regularly mentors less experienced analysts for their professional development. This individual will also be responsible for the consistency and integrity of data reported.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Others may be assigned.

Independently works with all levels of management and across multiple product lines to determine reporting/project requirements and to research/resolve technical issues with reporting tools and functionality.
Proactively works with team to create efficiencies in data retrieval and analysis, and ensure proper documentation of all reports.
Interprets data and presents key trends and important findings to product line leaders to help them turn it into actionable insights and improved performance.
Performs adhoc reporting with high complexity.
Serves as SME for multiple product lines, owns related processes and leads projects.
Manages customer’s expectations to ensure timely delivery of needed reporting/projects to clients and various business unit stakeholders.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Expert data gathering, analytical and data visualization skills.
Independent, logical thinker with strategic view of reporting offerings and proven ability to perform detailed data analysis, make recommendations and develop analytical reports and models that provide solutions for client.
Expert troubleshooting and QA skills, with ability to research and problem solve complex technical issues independently within a timely fashion.
Must demonstrate excellent professional communication skills through clearly written, concise and comprehensive documentation.
Experienced and comfortable making presentations to product line leaders, Directors and Executive Leadership across multiple product lines.
Advanced ability to work well with team members and Conifer leadership, respectful of all positions at all levels, as well as complete tasks independently and professionally.
Advanced organizational, communication, customer service, interpersonal, and time-management skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and voice concerns with the management when needed.
Expert knowledge/experience with reporting systems.
Expert level knowledge of relational database management systems such as MS SQL Server/MySQL, AS/400, Showcase, MS Access.
Expert level SQL language skills (creating/optimizing queries and stored procedures).
Expert level knowledge of desktop applications (Microsoft Excel, Word, Access and PowerPoint).
VBA.
Alteryx, MicroStrategy,Tableau, Power BI or similar a plus

Greystone is a private national commercial real estate finance company with an established reputation as a leader in multifamily and healthcare finance, with over $16 billion in loan originations in 2022. The firm consistently ranks in the Top 10 for Fannie Mae & Freddie Mac multifamily loan originations and is the #1 Overall HUD Multifamily and Healthcare Lender in the country. Greystone also ranks nationally as a top affordable housing, seniors housing, and small balance loan lender. A highly philanthropic company, Greystone donates more than half of its profits to charity each year.

Greystone's Special Servicing business is looking for an IT Business Analyst to join the team. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing current commercial real estate surveillance, special servicing, and underwriting software. This role will also be responsible for facilitating the documentation of business requirements, and collaboratively designing a solution for workflow, usability, and component and data integration. This role will work closely with stakeholders across the business line to ensure the IT systems meet their needs and expectations. This is a contract position for 6 months that, with exceptional performance, will likely be extended.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Gather and document business requirements from internal clients.
Translate business requirements into functional specifications and technical designs.
Conduct system testing and user acceptance testing to ensure quality and functionality.
Provide training and support to end-users on IT systems and applications.
Quickly understand existing applications and architecture.

Experience, Skills, and Abilities Required:

At least 5 years of experience as an IT Business Analyst in the commercial real estate industry is strongly preferred.
Knowledge of commercial real estate processes, terminology, and regulations.
Experience with other commercial real estate software, such as Situs, Real Insight, Trepp, Yardi, Argus, or CoStar, is strongly preferred.
Proficiency in Word Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, or other comparable tools for data analysis and presentation.
Excellent communication, collaboration, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

At Greystone, we believe that finding creative solutions for our clients comes from the collaboration of people with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to build an inclusive work environment that celebrates differences and empowers all individuals with opportunities to channel their entrepreneurial spirit. Greystone is an EEO employer.

Join our American Airlines family, and you’ll travel the world, grow your expertise and become the best version of you. As you embark on a new journey, you’ll tackle challenges with flexibility and grace, learning new skills and advancing your career while having the time of your life. Feel free to enrich both your personal and work life and hop on board!

Why you'll love this job
This job is a member of the Integrated Operations Team within the Integrated Operations Division.
Responsible for analyzing crew operations data, builds statistical predictive models and creates customized reports and PowerPoint presentations for executive leaders.
What you'll do
Derive meaningful and actionable insights from data that to help improve the crew operation
Develops statistical predictive models on large-scale datasets using statistical modeling such as linear regression, logistic regression, decision trees and other machine learning, or data mining techniques
Builds optimization and combinatorics models for optimal resource allocations
Performs advanced business analysis using SQL and Python to develop prescriptive operational improvement plans
Builds data visualization tools for root cause analysis
Automates and improves current programs, processes, reports and forecasts using SQL, Python, and etc.
Analyzes and develops requirements and provides documentation for IT projects
Develop presentations and present findings with recommendations to key stakeholders and senior management
Work collaboratively with various teams across the crew domain (Crew Scheduling, Crew Planning, Flight, Flight Service, IOC, etc.) to develop innovative and insightful solutions to improve crew performance
All you'll need for success

Minimum Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience

Bachelor's Degree in Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics or related quantitative field
3 years of related experience
1 year of experience with SQL querying and/or reporting or equivalent coursework

Preferred Qualifications- Education & Prior Job Experience

Master's Degree in Applied Statistics, Data Mining, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics
Programming experience with Python, Aviation experience, Credit scoring experience, Marketing analytics Experience

Skills, Licenses & Certifications

Highly proficient in use of Microsoft Office software, including Access, Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Excellent project management and organizational skills, with attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects on an ongoing basis
Excellent quantitative and analytical skills with an aptitude for problem solving
Ability to work effectively, meet deadlines, and shift priorities appropriately in a fast paced, dynamic work environment with great attention to detail
Knowledge of data processing/manipulation languages such SQL, R, Python in large database environments
What you'll get

Feel free to take advantage of all that American Airlines has to offer:

Travel Perks: Ready to explore the world? You, your family and your friends can reach 365 destinations on more than 6,800 daily flights across our global network.
Health Benefits: On day one, you’ll have access to your health, dental, prescription and vision benefits to help you stay well. And that’s just the start, we also offer virtual doctor visits, flexible spending accounts and more.
Wellness Programs: We want you to be the best version of yourself – that’s why our wellness programs provide you with all the right tools, resources and support you need.
401(k) Program: Available upon hire and, depending on the workgroup, employer contributions to your 401(k) program are available after one year.
Additional Benefits: Other great benefits include our Employee Assistance Program, pet insurance and discounts on hotels, cars, cruises and more
Feel free to be yourself at American

From the team members we hire to the customers we serve, inclusion and diversity are the foundation of the dynamic workforce at American Airlines. Our 20+ Employee Business Resource Groups are focused on connecting our team members to our customers, suppliers, communities and shareholders, helping team members reach their full potential and creating an inclusive work environment to meet and exceed the needs of our diverse world.

Job Title: Marketing Technology - Asset Manager & Business Analyst
Job Description:
About AT&T

At AT&T we’re redefining the future of connectivity. At our core is a passion to serve our customers with products and services that create connections, improve lives and allow millions to share the stories and experiences that matter. Our Corporate teams are fueled by innovation and a desire to connect the world in meaningful ways. Join our team and bring your bold ideas, supporting and transforming our business across areas like marketing, finance and more.

About the Marketing & Growth Organization

The Marketing & Growth Organization (MGO) is AT&T’s marketing engine, responsible for driving sustainable growth by deeply understanding and championing our customers, captivating them with compelling products, services and experiences; and building a culturally relevant and beloved brand. We pride ourselves in continuously striving to embody expertise, simplicity and inspiration in everything we do.

MGO is committed to building out next-generation marketing capabilities that will broaden our skills, deepen our expertise, and better align all AT&T’s marketing and communication resources.

About the Role

In this highly visible role, you will work across Marketing organizations, internal partners, and external agencies to manage creative asset utilization within the digital asset management (DAM) platform and capability enhancements that drive MROI (marketing return on investment). This role will drive tool adoption across the enterprise that enables our best-in-class marketing processes. Specifically, this role entails the creation of data management, quality assurance, compliance/risk management, and reporting strategies; the development of capability roadmaps, execution of those capabilities, with ongoing tracking and optimization across all marketing activities. You will act as the data/asset analytics conduit across DAM operations, using an agile lens, to identify optimization opportunities across Next Gen Marketing programs, and design seamless integration across workflows and platforms. This role operates in an agile and greenfield environment requiring diverse marketing background in operations, product ownership, and IT. May require considerable working knowledge of other major areas in technology, automation, and Gen AI. Considered an expert within the discipline.

You will be responsible for:

60%: Provides data governance, compliance, and risk management analysis across DAM utilization and engagement. Designs, implements, and optimizes solutions.
20%: Maintains user access and application management.
20%: Manages cloud infrastructure, asset cleansing, metadata tagging, and reusability metrics.

Core Competencies:

Experience in holistic marketing across multiple brands at large companies
Expertise in marketing technology/operations strategy and plan development, execution, and optimization
Management of large-scale teams and projects, including cross-functional collaboration
Executive presence to inspire confidence with internal and external constituents
Collaborative; willing to roll up their sleeves with the team and get close to the details
Change agent and motivator able to achieve alignment to a shared vision
Highly organized and accountable
Strategic and operational; able to think through strategic challenges and build ground-up solutions
Excellent problem solving skills and a keen attention to detail
Proficient MarTech experience with DAM software implementations (i.e. Bynder, Aprimo, Adobe, Uptempo, etc.)

Education & Experience:

Typically requires a Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any other IT related field
Experience: Typically requires 5+ years of experience in similar area of responsibility (marketing operations, software product ownership, martech, advertising, digital strategy, or marketing role within a consultancy, agency, or marketing-driven organization).

A career with us, a global leader in communications and technology, comes with big rewards. As part of our team, you’ll lead transformation surrounded by trailblazing industry leaders like you. You’ll be empowered to go above and beyond – making a difference through company-sponsored initiatives or connecting and networking through one of our many employee groups. And regardless of where you’re at in your career trajectory, you’ll be rewarded by the impact that comes with making a difference in the lives of millions. With AT&T, you’ll be a part of something greater, do incredible things and be rewarded with a chance to change the world.

Our Marketing Technology - Asset Manager & Business Analyst earn between $116,700 - $175,100. Not to mention all the other amazing rewards that working at AT&T offers. Individual starting salary within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training.




Joining our team comes with amazing perks and benefits:

Medical/Dental/Vision coverage
401(k) plan
Tuition reimbursement program
Paid Time Off and Holidays (based on date of hire, at least 23 days of vacation each year and 9 company-designated holidays)
Paid Parental Leave
Paid Caregiver Leave
Additional sick leave beyond what state and local law require may be available but is unprotected
Adoption Reimbursement · Disability Benefits (short term and long term)
Life and Accidental Death Insurance
Supplemental benefit programs: critical illness/accident hospital indemnity/group legal
Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
Extensive employee wellness programs
Employee discounts up to 50% off on eligible AT&T mobility plans and accessories, AT&T internet (and fiber where available) and AT&T phone

Overview:

Welcome Home! Build your career with Lennar:

As one of the nation’s largest builders, Lennar has built over one million new homes for families across America. Since 1954, our communities have catered to all lifestyles and family dynamics, whether you are a first-time or move-up buyer, multigenerational family, or active adult.

At Lennar, Everything’s Included in our homes, and Everyone’s Included on our team. Our Everyone’s Included vision is to be as inclusive and diverse as the communities we build unleashing the power of diversity within our workforce to drive innovation & sustainable growth.

Lennar's Core Values:
Our commitment to Quality, Value, and Integrity is the underlying foundation upon which Lennar was built, and these three fundamental principles still guide us in caring for our customers, associates, trade partners, shareholders, and community.

The Division Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing reports and models, reviewing financials, and data mining to formulate and deliver fact-based pricing strategies to division leadership. This position will work closely with various department to understand factors impacting the pricing and selling process to develop and implement strategic solutions that drive key operational metrics focused on improving financial results. The Division Business Analyst must possess the intellectual curiosity to actively seek out new areas of potential improvement and drill into the details to find the root cause of a problem, which requires the willingness to question results and assumptions, and an internal drive for continuous improvement.
Responsibilities:
Manage overall pricing process including providing recommendations and obtaining approvals on home-by-home pricing and release order and communicating results across the sales organization.
Recommend price adjustments to Management based on an analysis of historical sales trends, current and future market conditions and the overall market supply and demand dynamic.
Collaborate with Division lines of business to develop a deep understanding of the process, strategies and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that influence top line Revenue growth.
Provide revenue management functional expertise and leadership to management team and market sales leaders.
Provide an objective point of view to complex business and issues based on a deep understanding of data and analytics as well as business principals.
Regularly translate data, insights, and forecasts into actionable and relevant recommendations by utilizing visualization and/or data analysis tools, presentations and other means to effectively communicate clear and concise recommendations to senior division leadership.
Track, create, maintain, and analyze data.
Develop new skills, techniques, and statistical models for predicting future operational results, costs and key performance metrics.
Consolidate, prepare, and analyze operational data to understand cause and effect relationships and identify and share root causes.
Oversee day-to-day implementation and analysis of the different initiatives.

#CB #LI-VR1

Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirement:
Bachelor’s Degree in related field (business, finance, etc) preferred.
MBA would be helpful.
2 years as a Revenue and/or Pricing Manager, Business analyst or comparable experience preferred.
Experience in the homebuilding industry would be helpful.
Experience with business software preferred (Salesforce, JDE, Business Intelligence)
Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, etc.)

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the ability to work in excess of eight hours per day in the confined quarters of an office. Also requires the ability bend, stoop, reach, lift, move and/or carry items less than 25 pounds. Finger dexterity in operating a computer keyboard and calculator. Requires sitting at a computer monitor for extended periods of time, completing paperwork and to receive/return phone messages.


Additional Requirements:
Demonstrates skills and experience developing and performing quantitative analysis which may include financial and/or statistical modeling.
Experience presenting to and communicating with Executives.
Strong oral, written, listening and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively communicate in business terms using simple, concise and relatable examples.
Strong quantitative and analytical foundation with the ability to translate data into actionable and relevant insights and answers to questions.
Engages and establish cooperative working relationships with Associates at various lines of business.
Ability to adapt thinking based on new points of view and/or changes in operating environments.
Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, delegate work and provide leadership across functions.
Prioritize and plan work activities, use time efficiently, set goals and objectives and develop realistic action plans.
Think critically to identify and resolve problems in a timely manner, gather and analyze information skillfully, develop alternative solutions and work well in group problem solving situations.
Demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness, look for ways to improve and promote quality, apply feedback to improve performance and monitor own work to ensure quality.
This position outlines the basic tasks and requirements for the position noted. It is not a comprehensive listing of all job duties of the Associates. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Lennar is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices and laws.
Type: Regular Full-Time

Job Title: Lead Analyst – SAP PRA Business Systems - 2310002255 - Dallas, TX
Job Description:
Summary:

Energy Transfer, is currently seeking an SAP PRA specialist to support their PRA system. The PRA system is heavily customized and will require skills to reverse engineer processes and trouble shoot custom and standard SAP PRA issues. The project went live 6 months ago and requires production support. This position is part of the Accounting and Finance organization and supports the Crude Oil Acquisition and Marketing segment of the Organization. The position will involve working closely with Division Order, Regulatory, Deal Capture, and IT.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Serve as SAP PRA system specialist for the business
Designated by a Business Application Owner to be the business liaison for a specific application function
Should be able to analyze tickets that come in, understand if the solution needed is a code fix, process change or an issue with the master/transaction data.
Understand the customizations in the system by reading documents, debugging and recreating data in the test system
Fix issues arising in the PRA interfaces
Able to resolve issues in Valuation, Payments and other PRA modules in a timely manner
Escalated support of Users, Super Users, and SME's
Work with the Functional Analysts, Technical Analysts, and other technical resources as necessary to resolve issues
Should be able to replicate issues in the test system and reverse engineer processes with minimal supervision
Strong debugging skills will be very helpful
Business requirements definition and prioritization
User acceptance testing coordination (or execution)
Assessment of business process improvement recommendations and prioritization
Proactive business process and application improvement recommendations
Work alongside business as liaison to IT for PRA trouble shooting
Gain knowledge of all marketing contracts, division order processes, and regulatory requirements as they relate to SAP PRA
Prepare and analyze metrics as it relates to the various back office functional teams
Assist management in the creation of system reports
Able to adapt to rapidly changing priorities

Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:

Minimum of 5 years of working in SAP with strong knowledge in SAP PRA
Knowledge of check write process in PRA
Experience troubleshooting issues arising in valuation
Knowledge of Contractual Allocations and related processes
Needs to understand the Ownership process, knowledge of cross reference setup and how each PRA module relates to other modules
Able to understand customizations in the system and become comfortable working with them quickly
Strong Analytic skills to understand the root cause of issues
Ability to debug programs to identify the issue will be very helpful as the system is very customized will be very helpful
Experienced in a customized SAP system which requires a lot of troubleshooting
Able to recreate issues in the test system
Analytic and data analysis skills required, especially MS Excel
Strong communication skills
Highly detailed oriented
Able to prioritize and multi-task

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 2 - 5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 5 - 8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

EOE

Benefits:

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off

Schedule:

Monday to Friday

Education:

Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

SAP PRA: 5 years (Required)
check writing process: 5 years (Required)
contractual allocations: 3 years (Required)

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry’s technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Physical Requirements : General Office Demands

At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you’ll join us. We can’t do it without you.

Jack Henry is hiring a Business Analyst II to join our Ovation Enterprise Service team. If you are interested in using your banking and analytical skills in a fast-paced department, this position may be the perfect opportunity for you! The Ovation Enterprise Services team is a provider of internal integrated environments across a broad spectrum of user groups. The position will focus on the operation and support of 10 Ovation Banks in the Jack Henry network. Operations and support include using SilverLake, CIF 2020 and Core Director systems along with all applicable complimentary products. The Analyst will work directly with the Sales and Knowledge Enablement Teams, assist with transactions, scenarios, bank copies, release upgrades, support testing and daily operation reviews.

This position requires a flexible work schedule to meet ongoing responsibilities but may be worked remotely within the U.S. This position also requires travel for a least 2 team meetings a year.

What you’ll be responsible for:
Researches, analyzes, creates, and maintains applicable Policies & Procedures.
Provides frontline support for the sales and internal education teams.
Troubleshoots and repairs customer product complaints.
Tests release upgrades and fixes to ensure quality.
Provides operations support for various interfaces.
Keeps customers informed of all enhancements, troubleshooting, and fixes.
May perform other job duties as assigned.

Minimum of 3 years of experience in back office operations, software implementation or software technical support from a financial institution or FinTech.
Experience with any Jack Henry Core system or Complementary product.
Strong knowledge of the financial industry.
Demonstrated communication and customer service skills.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s Degree preferred.
Strong understanding of JH Solutions and operations.
Strong project management skills.
Strong analytical skills.
Able to plan, manage/facilitate, collect, analyze, summarize, and present data in order to support business decisions and solve business problems.
Able to identify and implement process improvement initiatives.

The Title:

Restaurant Excellence Operations Analyst. Are you a naturally curious person that is always asking “why”? Do you enjoy thinking about ways to improve processes and experiences? Are you detail and analytics-oriented and enjoy fast-paced and hands-on work? If this is you, we want you to join our team! The Restaurant Excellence Analyst role will be an integral part of the growing Restaurant Excellence team, where we are working to ensure CAVA’s restaurant procedures are consistent throughout the brand and easy to execute. We are looking into future technological innovation opportunities for our kitchens and restaurants, as well as short-term improvements that can unlock new levels of efficiency and elevate both the Team Member and customer experience.




What You’ll Do:

Identify opportunities to enhance CAVA’s operational procedures, standards, and processes
Ensure projects are tested thoroughly for operational excellence by working side-by-side with project and restaurant teams to gather qualitative and quantitative feedback and leveraging data to provide actionable insights that balance business priorities
Conduct analysis in areas including: operational planning, capacity utilization, productivity, and evaluate impact
Work collaboratively with cross-functional partners (including Development, Technology, Engineering, Culinary, Digital, etc.), restaurant teams, and/or external vendors throughout project lifecycles
Ensure appropriate methodology, measurements, tools and quantitative techniques (e.g., data collection, time studies) are applied in projects

About CES:

At CES we have a bold ambition for growth. We are passionate about delivering an unrivalled service for our customers and providing a strong culture with career opportunities for our people.



Across IT we are on an exciting mission to ensure we harness our growth opportunities by designing our technology architecture and solutions for constant evolution. We have a fast-growing technology team delivering a portfolio of transformative work, expanding our digital options, and upgrading and future-proofing our systems to place us at the forefront of the marketplace.

We believe that teams who design, own and run our technology solutions are more connected to the value they create. We are always looking to improve, collaborate and innovate and this is where you come in…

Summary

You will be expected to understand the real needs of customers and colleagues and collaborate with technical teams to transform these into small achievable deliverables, ensuring the delivery of quality and value. You will be expected to work across all areas of the business on complex initiatives and help promote business analysis and IT within the organization.
Responsibilities:
Work cross functionally with finance teams, business managers, and other stakeholders to gather and document detailed business and functional requirements related to financial systems.
Understand user need, pain points, and challenges, and translate them into actionable project specifications.
Analyze existing financial systems, tools, processes, and integrations to identify inefficiencies, data integrity issues, and opportunities for improvement.
Collaborate with IT teams to design and implement financial systems solutions and enhancements. Ensure that proposed solutions align with best practices, maintain data security, and improve overall efficiency in financial operations.
Support and develop test plans to ensure testing can be conducted for accurate results and compliance with business requirements.
Collaborate with stakeholders to design and generate financial reports, dashboards, and data visualizations.
Enable data-driven decision-making by providing accurate and timely financial insights.
In conjunction with the Finance SME, identify opportunities to streamline and automate finance processes, driving operational efficiency and reducing manual interventions.
Create documentation to support system configuration, processes, and training materials to assists finance team members in effectively using finance systems and technologies.
Collaborate with Finance SME, support the change management process by helping teams adapt to new systems and processes, addressing any resistance or concerns.
Compile and manage backlog of user stories created in collaboration with the delivery team.
Utilize outstanding communication skills to be a conduit for technical and non-technical teams.
Facilitate workshops and meetings at all stages of the delivery lifecycle.
Essentail Experience:
3+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst.
Experience working within finance, accounting, or banking.
Proficiency in finance-related systems such as ERP.
Good knowledge and practical experience of performing analysis within Agile/Scrum methodologies.
Experience of modelling business processes across different departments and identifying valuable improvements
Knowledge of industry standard tools; JIRA, confluence etc.
Desired Experience:
Experience of working in a B2B or B2C business.
Recognized business analysis qualification.
Understanding of finance processes, financial reporting, and accounting principles
Knowledge/experience of JIRA Software and Confluence.
