English (US) THE ROLE AND THE COMPANY

Heidelberg Materials provides the materials to build our future. Our future is sustainable. Our future is digital. And it goes way beyond cement, aggregates and ready-mixed concrete. Heidelberg Materials North America, previously known as Lehigh Hanson, operates more than 450 locations with approximately 9,000 employees in the U.S. and Canada.

We are seeking a qualified Strategy and Development Analyst for its Irving (Las Colinas), TX location. The position of Strategy and Development Analyst will be responsible for developing a wide variety of analyses and documents that will be used by the senior management of Heidelberg Materials and the Strategy and Development team. The candidate will also support the Competence Center Logistics for 20% of their time. The candidate must be able to build positive working relationships with managers and employees throughout the Company and to manage multiple tasks simultaneously. The candidate must have a strong working knowledge of market research, financial statements, and strategic planning.

What You’ll Get to Do

Prepare comprehensive analyses of the economic, demographic, and competitive landscapes of current and potential markets as well as financial projection of businesses and projects.
Aid in assessing financial and strategic attractiveness and pursuing attractive opportunities, including organic growth projects as well as joint ventures, swaps, divestitures, mergers, and acquisitions.
Convert information and analyses into actionable decision frameworks and summary presentations for senior management.
Assist in creating strategies and plans to drive revenue growth, value enhancement and cost optimization.
Support the Strategy and Development Department with all aspects of strategic development job duties.

Essential Experience and Skills

BA/BS degree with a major or focus in finance, business, economics, quantitative analysis, research or operations preferred.
2 to 4 years relevant professional experience gained in the building materials industry or a position in market research, consulting, M&A, operations, or finance.
Superior problem solving, financial, research and analytical skills.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Work well in a team and independently.
Proven ability to think creatively and strategically.
Demonstrated drive, initiative, and adaptability.
Excellent presentation skills and attention to detail.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products, including Excel, PowerPoint, Access, and Word.

Competitive base salary and participation in our annual incentive plan
Competitive benefits program
401k retirement savings plan with an automatic company contribution as well as matching contributions

About us:

We are Deoleo. The Olive Oil Company

For centuries, our olive oil has been a staple of kitchens around the globe. Armed with knowledge and passion, we are focused on producing quality olive oil and leading our industry into a more sustainable future.

Deoleo is the world’s largest olive oil company with world-leading brands such as Carbonell, Bertolli, and Carapelli. Producing our oil in Spain and Italy; and distributing our brands from Australia to Alaska. We´re a multinational company with offices in many locations, headquartered in Madrid, Spain.

Our mission is to nurture healthier futures by making Mediterranean goodness available to all.

Our ambition is to be the undisputed leader of the olive oil industry.

Without compromising traditional flavors, the company strives to offer premium-quality products in line with today’s lifestyles. All of Deoleo’s brands meet and exceed the extensive, strict quality requirements of the International Olive Council (IOC), and the European Union (EU). Beyond olive oil, Deoleo products include premium vinegars and the finest table olives available.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for an ambitious and talented profile to join our Commercial Department as Sales Analyst (Onsite) Located in Dallas.

MISSION

The Sales Analyst role aims to bolster and assist regional Sales teams by generating insightful reports that support sales initiatives. This position involves offering key insights into sales trends across essential items and categories. Additionally, the role entails providing cross-functional support in collaboration with Marketing, Finance, and Operations.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct comprehensive sales and market data analysis for both internal and external stakeholders in a dynamic environment.
Perform competitive analysis across manufacturers, brands, and package types, identifying trends, opportunities, and challenges crucial to core business areas.
Utilize syndicated and/or retailer-specific data to formulate, organize, and present information and recommendations supporting the sales team and critical retail initiatives. This includes assessing retailer performance, identifying trends and opportunities, evaluating pricing and promotion effectiveness, etc.
Provide comprehensive commercial support to the sales team, including information dissemination, monthly reporting, regional scorecards, and the creation of impactful selling stories.
Develop and assist in the creation of presentation decks for customer meetings.
Develop and refine category strategies and tactics in collaboration with Marketing to build customer partnerships that deliver volume and profit goals.
Create promotional analysis to support Regional Business Managers' promotional decisions.
Ensure timely entry of baselines and promotions into our forecasting software.
Act as a technical resource for the business, proficiently handling reporting tools such as Power BI and Excel Power Query.

Education

BS/BA degree in a business discipline or equivalent experience

Experience

1-2 years of experience in Sales, Category Management, or Planning within a CPG organization.
Proven ability to work with diverse data sources and strong analytical skills.
Experience with syndicated data (IRI, Nielsen, Spins) is a plus.
Highly skilled in a commercial mindset and understanding of marketing and sales principles.
Familiarity with data analysis and forecasting methods.

Competencies

Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Process-oriented, fact-based, and a sense of urgency.
Quick learner with a proactive approach to applying new technologies.
Strong analytical skills with a solution-oriented mindset.
Cross-cultural awareness and ability to collaborate with diverse cultures.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (DAX, Power Query (M)) and PowerPoint.
Advanced skills in Power BI or Tableau preferred.
SQL and Python knowledge is a plus.
Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish is a plus.


Our DEOLEO “Live Green” benefits will include:

DEOLEO Welcome basket, with some of our key products & brands (Carbonell, Hojiblanca, and others).

Flexible working will be subject to the provisions for each country depending on its legislation and post-pandemic situation.

DEOLEO Live Green digital tour with a specific focus on bringing life to our end-to-end processes (from harvest to bottle).

Access to our Deoleo Learning Academy where you can experience the power of inspirational online assessments and courses. Our training is designed to stimulate the development of all the key competencies to face the challenges of today and tomorrow, we have more than a hundred courses available.

Be part of the DEOLEO Team and you will find:



Leadership: We lead the way and empower everyone to get the job done no matter their position or level in DEOLEO.
Diversity: We work in a place where everyone can fit in, embracing everyone's contribution.
Sustainability: We act in the best interest of Olive Oil's sustainable future.
Resilience: We can adapt and react with speed without losing focus on the results.

If you believe you match these values, we are looking forward to meeting you! We are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

At DEOLEO we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. And therefore, DIVERSITY is one of our key values. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact.

Ready to have a look into what´s going on in DEOLEO?

Job Title: Sr Business Systems Analyst I - CDS
Job Description:
Summary

Description

About Us:
Companion Data Services provides leading IT solutions and managed services. We operate multiple geographically disperse data centers, including two of the nation’s largest healthcare data centers – both rated among the top five percent of data centers worldwide by MIPS.
With three U.S. locations and decades of experience in government, commercial and education markets, our innovative solutions and reliable services allow clients to focus on core business and improve outcomes.
Our data centers host applications process billions of transactions, supporting state, federal and commercial business.
Position Purpose:
Defines customer needs in technical and business contexts. Ensure the proposed technical and business solutions meet the customer's objectives for the work effort. Provide guidance with planning and prioritization of business analysis activities in support of large project and support efforts.
This position will be responsible for:
Supporting the FFS Workload B contract production support team by ensuring that the Fiscal Intermediary Shared System (FISS) and Multi Carrier System (MCS) applications hosted by CDS are up and available to the users by their required SLA time, reviewing request from the Medicare Administrative Contractors (MAC)s, CMS and the Shared System Maintainer (SSM), scheduling customer checkouts, data purges and testing. Analyzing the impact to customers reporting issues and escalating issue by priority, establishing, and driving resolution bridge lines. Completing morning task and reports, validating completion of customer request.
This is an on-site position in any of the Celerian group locations in Dallas, TX, Columbia, SC, or Nashville, TN.
What You'll Do:
Elicit and document user requirements to meet a business objective. Identify and validate requirements and organize the information into a logical document using business analysis models that is understood by the customer and Information Systems.
Respond to questions and ensure understanding of why the business solution was chosen. Guide both technical and customer departments in the development of the systems
Ensure the accurate deployment of solutions through review of problem logs, assisting with test plans and test matrices, and other analysis activities
Validate the business need for solutions to business problems and process improvements.
Facilitate the transfer of knowledge about the "big picture" direction of the business units to others who support them.
Provide input on the business direction for system changes.
Mentor less experienced business systems analysts.
To Qualify For This Position, You'll Need:
Required Education:
Bachelor's degree
OR 4 years job related work experience
OR Associate's and 2 years job related work experience

Required Work Experience:
6 years of IT business analysis experience.

Required Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated expertise in the concepts of the supported business unit.
Demonstrated knowledge of standard industry practices and procedures for the business unit.
Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, including the ability to express complex technical and business concepts to all management levels, peers, and the business units.
Able to influence and negotiate solutions to business problems.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
Understands how IT affects an organization and is able to link it to business processes.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Able to read and comment on test plans and test matrices, project plans, and scope and design documents.
Has a conceptual understanding of project management techniques.
We Prefer That You Have:
IT Mainframe business analysis experience
5 years of Medicare claims experience
3 years of FISS/MCS applications experience

Preferred Software and Other Tools:
Visio, MS Project or similar software, data mining using DB2, SQL, and/or other tools.

Preferred Licenses and Certificates:
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), HIPAA, LOMA
What We Can Do For You:
Our comprehensive benefits package includes:
401(k) retirement savings plan with company match
Subsidized health plans and free vision coverage
Life insurance
Paid annual leave - the longer you work here, the more you earn
Ten paid holidays
On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in major locations
Wellness programs and a healthy lifestyle premium discount
Tuition assistance
Service recognition
What to Expect Next:
After submitting your application, our recruiting team members will review your resume to ensure you meet the qualifications. This may include a brief telephone interview or email communication with our recruiter to verify resume specifics and salary requirements. Management will be conducting interviews with those candidates who qualify with prioritization given to those candidates who demonstrate the preferred qualifications.

JOB DESCRIPTION

BASIC PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF POSITION
The Sr Sales Process Optimization Analyst will support the organization by focusing on: Report Development, Quality Control, and Product Management, Process Improvement and automation. They will also be responsible for enhancing and maintaining Power BI and Data Visualization tools. This highly visible position will have the opportunity to work across the organization, with multiple layers of employees and management, and be part of building out a Data Analytics department for the organization.
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES: This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State, and local laws / regulations and the Company’s policies, procedures, and guidelines:


Develop and establish reporting to track and maintain operations. Up-to-date monitoring of operations with the goal of implementing continuous improvements.
Streamlining and automating reports using G Suite, Microsoft Suite, WinShuttle, etc.
Ensures data accessibility and distribution by supporting ad-hoc data requests, creating and automating reporting and managing routine distribution of regular reports to both leaderships.
Work collaboratively with Management Team to evaluate, design, execute, and monitor business processes across all departments ensuring that the outcomes align with strategic goals.
Provide day to day operational support and troubleshooting for applications.
Develop SQL queries to manipulate analyze and report on large data sets
Data extraction, creation, manipulation of multiple files and or databases
SQL/PL SQL code tuning and Query optimization.
SIT/UAT testing and identifying data quality issues.
Analyze reporting requirements, study existing reports for layout, formula and calculations, derived values, restrictions, attributes, and variants.
Support informed decision-making throughout the company by ensuring high data quality & integrity, building reports & dashboards, and conducting analyses on historical data.
Other duties as assigned by management.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business preferred.
With a degree at least 5 years in data analytics required.
In lieu of a degree at least 7 years of data analytics required.
Advanced Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Power BI, Python, Java, C#/C++, Power Platform, Smartsheets, Winshuttle & SAP/BW experience.
SQL experience, including the ability to write and troubleshoot SQL Code and design (stored procedures, functions, tables, views, indexes, sub queries, conditional joins, case statements, etc.)
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Typical office environment.

The IT Business Analyst & Planning Coordinator is primarily responsible for the planning and execution of the department activities as a resource to the communities that plan and implement Governance, Portfolio and Project Management processes. Job Title: Business Execution Consultant - Power BI Specialist
Job Description:
#HRJOBS

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking an infrastructure support Business Execution Consultant to join the Learning & Development (L&D) Business Execution Team. This team provides infrastructure and workflow support to the L&D department. This role specializes in using data analytics and Power BI to enable faster decision making through data.

In this role, you will:
Using Power BI to develop solutions using analytical, critical thinking, and creative design skills to enable end users to understand complex data and make faster decisions.
Coordinate with key stakeholders, partners, and Subject Matter Experts across the business to ensure the approach will deliver the prioritized business outcomes.
Demonstrate agile mindsets, behaviors, and ways of working, including peer up-skilling, feedback, and continuous team improvement.
Identify opportunities for process improvement by conducting root cause testing of all compliance and business metrics
Determine areas of strength or Business Execution opportunity within defined scope of work
Present recommendations to develop, implement, and monitor strategic approaches, effectiveness of support function, and business performance improvement opportunities for managing risks of the business
Exercise independent judgment and provide guidance in diverse support functions and operations
Collaborate and consult with leaders and executive management
Provide work direction to less experienced Strategy and Execution staff
Required Qualifications:
2+ years of Business Execution, Implementation, or Strategic Planning experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
2+ years of experience creating dashboards and building reports with Power BI.
Desired Qualifications:
2+ years of human resources (HR) experience.
Experience with Agile methodologies, including the gathering and refining of user stories and sprint planning
Expertise with the Microsoft Power Platform including: SharePoint, PowerApps and Power Automate
Strong problem solving and analytical skills with the ability to determine root cause, recommend solutions, and clearly articulate the risk/benefit analysis of each option
Familiarity with relational database structures and large data tables / data sets.
Experience in human-centered design/design thinking and/or service design.
Experience consulting and being a change agent within all levels of the organization.
Ability to execute in a fast paced, high demand environment while balancing multiple priorities.
Ability to negotiate, influence, and collaborate to build successful relationships.
Ability to work effectively, as well as independently, in a team environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to create executive level presentation materials a plus.

Manager, Product Management - Human Resources

In HR we are focused on building intuitive experiences for Capital One associates. Our product managers partner with cross functional teams of product, tech, design and data to define, design and build technology solutions that engage and serve thousands of associates daily.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Integrated Problem Solving

Develop and champion a bold vision that drives meaningful outcomes by embracing the art of the possible

Build frameworks for complex decision making that enable effective debate and accelerate getting to the right answer

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

ERP Programmer Analyst

Department: Information Technologies
FLSA Status: Exempt

Summary:

Documenting solution designs and technical requirements for the implementation and support of ERP Systems and Custom applications. Ability to quickly understand client business expectations, transform the required features into technical specifications, and track system deliverables to ensure the quality level is attained. This position requires a results-driven team player attitude with strong business acumen and interpersonal skills, robust data analysis and logical abilities, time management skills, experience with formal requirements traceability, and knowledge of IT SDLC methods and ITIL best practices.

Agile development practices and experience in a Scrum/Agile framework desirable.

Job Requirements:

· Serve as techno-functional IT team member, responsible for defining, and documenting technical and business requirements, design, and development for ERP Systems that include INFOR SyteLine v8, CSI 10 and NetSuite.

· Strong Analysis skills and responsibility for ensuring specifications are complete, comprehensive, technically feasible, in alignment with system capabilities, conform with IT and regulatory standards, and follow consistent documentation practices.

· Good domain knowledge and experience with Financials, Supply Chain, Order Management and Manufacturing.

· Ability to provide Super User and End User training.

· Mentor and train junior team members.

· Assists in the preparation and execution of use-case tests, formal testing scripts and oversees approval for user acceptance plans.

· Manages and tracks status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; updates and refines, as necessary.

· Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of agreed requirements– verbally and in written form to business and IT sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.

· As technical liaison confirms project scoping for IT solutions; communicates effectively to identify options, explain issues, recommend solutions, manage risks, and reduce escalations during project design and delivery.

· Provides incident resolution oversight, including first time-right, root cause analysis, and corrective actions.

· Work performed in the office in a light industrial setting; exposure to manufacturing environments and working on the shop floor with users.

· May require about 10% travel to other PlayPower office and plant locations as required.

· Other duties as required.

Qualifications and Technical Skills:

Minimum of 5 years of experience with ERP Systems. Experience with INFOR SyteLine 8, 9, CSI10 and NetSuite preferred. The ideal candidate would have worked with multiple ERPs including the above and have prior experience with full ERP life-cycle implementations. Expertise in a manufacturing environment and strong knowledge of the modules for Financial Management, Supply Chain Management and Purchasing, Sales Management, Estimating Customer Orders, Shipping, Receiving, Inventory Management, Planning and Scheduling processes to serve as internal ERP consultant and Subject Matter Expert.

· Minimum of 5 years’ hands-on experience in business analysis, programming, development, or support role with SQL Server environments.

· Deep expertise with T-SQL, stored procedures, SQL Queries, SSRS is needed and experience with XML, HTML, VB .NET and C# .NET programming would be a plus.

· Strong understanding of underlying ERP schema, tables and database level entity-relationship models with ability to create, understand, and run SQL ad-hoc query scripts and reports.

· Experience managing formal requirements matrix and documenting comprehensive technical specifications.

· Expertise in testing validation methods with use-case development and defect tracking (JIRA and Agile experience preferred).

· Prior experience working with standard IT SDLC processes, ITIL best practices, Agile development/delivery and working with geographically distributed teams.

· Consultative and analytical skills with effective solution design, technical planning, and problem-solving abilities.

· Fluent with technical processes and nomenclature, and disciplined approach to reporting/tracking key metrics.

· Experienced with code reuse and source code version control techniques.

Job Title: Sr Business Systems Analyst I - CDS
Job Description:
Summary

Description

About Us:
Companion Data Services provides leading IT solutions and managed services. We operate multiple geographically disperse data centers, including two of the nation’s largest healthcare data centers – both rated among the top five percent of data centers worldwide by MIPS.
With three U.S. locations and decades of experience in government, commercial and education markets, our innovative solutions and reliable services allow clients to focus on core business and improve outcomes.
Our data centers host applications process billions of transactions, supporting state, federal and commercial business.
Position Purpose:
Defines customer needs in technical and business contexts. Ensure the proposed technical and business solutions meet the customer's objectives for the work effort. Provide guidance with planning and prioritization of business analysis activities in support of large project and support efforts.
This position will be responsible for:
Supporting the FFS Workload B contract production support team by ensuring that the Fiscal Intermediary Shared System (FISS) and Multi Carrier System (MCS) applications hosted by CDS are up and available to the users by their required SLA time, reviewing request from the Medicare Administrative Contractors (MAC)s, CMS and the Shared System Maintainer (SSM), scheduling customer checkouts, data purges and testing. Analyzing the impact to customers reporting issues and escalating issue by priority, establishing, and driving resolution bridge lines. Completing morning task and reports, validating completion of customer request.
This is an on-site position in any of the Celerian group locations in Dallas, TX, Columbia, SC, or Nashville, TN.
What You'll Do:
Elicit and document user requirements to meet a business objective. Identify and validate requirements and organize the information into a logical document using business analysis models that is understood by the customer and Information Systems.
Respond to questions and ensure understanding of why the business solution was chosen. Guide both technical and customer departments in the development of the systems
Ensure the accurate deployment of solutions through review of problem logs, assisting with test plans and test matrices, and other analysis activities
Validate the business need for solutions to business problems and process improvements.
Facilitate the transfer of knowledge about the "big picture" direction of the business units to others who support them.
Provide input on the business direction for system changes.
Mentor less experienced business systems analysts.
To Qualify For This Position, You'll Need:
Required Education:
Bachelor's degree
OR 4 years job related work experience
OR Associate's and 2 years job related work experience

Required Work Experience:
6 years of IT business analysis experience.

Required Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated expertise in the concepts of the supported business unit.
Demonstrated knowledge of standard industry practices and procedures for the business unit.
Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, including the ability to express complex technical and business concepts to all management levels, peers, and the business units.
Able to influence and negotiate solutions to business problems.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
Understands how IT affects an organization and is able to link it to business processes.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Able to read and comment on test plans and test matrices, project plans, and scope and design documents.
Has a conceptual understanding of project management techniques.
We Prefer That You Have:
IT Mainframe business analysis experience
5 years of Medicare claims experience
3 years of FISS/MCS applications experience

Preferred Software and Other Tools:
Visio, MS Project or similar software, data mining using DB2, SQL, and/or other tools.

Preferred Licenses and Certificates:
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), HIPAA, LOMA
What We Can Do For You:
Our comprehensive benefits package includes:
401(k) retirement savings plan with company match
Subsidized health plans and free vision coverage
Life insurance
Paid annual leave - the longer you work here, the more you earn
Ten paid holidays
On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in major locations
Wellness programs and a healthy lifestyle premium discount
Tuition assistance
Service recognition
What to Expect Next:
After submitting your application, our recruiting team members will review your resume to ensure you meet the qualifications. This may include a brief telephone interview or email communication with our recruiter to verify resume specifics and salary requirements. Management will be conducting interviews with those candidates who qualify with prioritization given to those candidates who demonstrate the preferred qualifications.

We participate in E-Verify and comply with the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations
Job Description:
Why UT Southwestern?

With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. At UT Southwestern, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development that align with your future goals and help to provide security for you and your family. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more that are all available on the day you start work. UT Southwestern is honored to be a Veteran Friendly work environment that is home to approximately 800 veterans. We value your integrity, dedication, and the commitment you’ve made to our country. We’re proud to support your next mission. Ranked by Forbes as one of the Top 10 National Employers, we invite you to be a part of the UT Southwestern team where you’ll discover teamwork, professionalism, and consistent opportunities for growth.
Job Summary

UT Southwestern Medical Center is hiring for Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations

Academic & Business Operations is actively seeking a highly motivated and career-minded individual to join our Operations team as a Senior Financial Analyst with Healthcare experience. In this exciting position, you will be responsible for a range of activities, including institutional compensation and productivity analysis, multiple system development and reporting initiatives, and a vast array of complex ad-hoc analyses required of the office/role. You will liaison with a range of academic leadership position, and be challenged to prepare complex deliverables at an executive level.

This role offers a hybrid work arrangement, combining the benefit of both remote and in-office work environment (two(2) days in office, (3) days remote, subject to change).

Experience and Education

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or other related field and four (4) years progressively responsible experience in finance and/or accounting with experience in planning, forecasting, and financial analysis.
Job Duties

Completes variety of complex monthly financial management reports and reviews all reports for errors and inconsistencies; analyzes variations in forecasts and actual performance; determines reasons for variance; develops recommendations for improvement; completes written summaries of financial data.
Prepares and/or supervises preparation of monthly financial reports, schedules for annual financial reports, and reports to various government agencies, ensuring conformance of such reports with applicable procedures and regulations of University of Texas System and Federal and State agencies.
Identifies areas of poor performance, presents findings, and makes recommendations to upper management.
Prepares financial models and conducts financial analyses.
May maintain controls for policies and procedures for financial system; develops and maintains delegation of authority of various procedures, such as check requests, refunds, invoice approval, bad debt write-offs, etc.
Completes more complex special projects as requested.
**Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned.

it’s what’s inside that counts

_______________________________


There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Day 1 benefits coverage with low cost medical, vision, dental
Paid-time off and vacation starting Day 1
Competitive compensation and bonuses
Company-paid Lifestyle fund, life and disability insurance
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Training and advancement opportunities
Why This Job

CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel industry and grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day in an office cubicle, operating a crane or running the melt shop at one of our mills, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.

What You'll Do
Execute cash management activities including the collections and disbursement of funds, borrowings from the company's working capital facilities, etc.
Properly recording to the general ledger
Plan domestic and international cash position using forecast projections
Work with Treasury Managers to ensure proper funding of inter-company loans from both domestic and international funds
Provide banking support to operations
Review and approve bank charges and fees
Analyze data to identify and interpret patterns and trends
Support Manager on various other initiatives
What You'll Need
1 – 2 years of experience in a retail bank or cash management operations preferred but not required
Good mathematical skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Strong independent thinker
Good internal and external customer service skills
Ability to demonstrate good judgment, be focused, and maintain a high level of accuracy
Professional and ability to communicate effectively with bankers and with all levels within the organization
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
Your Education
Bachelors Degree required

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.


If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

Job Title: Sr. Business Analysis Manager – Retention and Revenue Excellence Strategy
Job Description:
Be unstoppable with us!
T-Mobile is synonymous with innovation–and you could be part of the team that disrupted an entire industry! We reinvented customer service, brought real 5G to the nation, and now we’re shaping the future of technology in wireless and beyond. Our work is as exciting as it is rewarding, so consider the career opportunity below as your invitation to grow with us, make big things happen with us, above all, #BEYOU with us. Together, we won’t stop!

Join Our Dynamic Revenue and Retention Excellence Team!

Are you a strategic thinker dedicated to driving incremental revenue, reducing churn, and improving customer experiences? If you're a visionary who excels in finding opportunities and crafting innovative approaches, then we want you on our team!

As a Senior Business Analysis Manager, you will be a key player in our Revenue and Retention Excellence team. This pivotal role demands a creative problem solver with sharp business acumen and a track record of driving impactful solutions. You'll leverage available data and analysis to derive insights, perform root-cause analysis, and craft compelling business strategies. Your role will involve collaborating with key partners to execute these strategies, using your outstanding analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills..

Key Responsibilities:

Strategic Point of Contact: Act as the primary point of contact for our overall Care strategy, encompassing churn and revenue activities.

Craft Compelling Strategies: Use available data and analysis to influence resource allocation across the organization, driving impactful business strategies.

Root Cause Analysis: Drive detailed root cause analyses, combining analytical techniques and keen business acumen to uncover underlying drivers and facilitate strategic decision-making.

Influential Storytelling: Craft persuasive narratives from complex analyses, influencing leadership through impactful presentations.

Partner Management: Manage critical relationships across a diverse range of team members, often with competing priorities.

Our Ideal Candidate:

Creative Problem Solver: You excel at finding impactful solutions and have a track record to prove it.

Strategic Thinker: You can balance short-term gains with long-term objectives, driving the success of our revenue and retention efforts.

Effective Communicator: You can present intricate insights clearly and persuasively, encouraging collaborations and influencing decisions.

Skilled Negotiator: Your ability to encourage teamwork and influence decisions makes you a valuable asset to our team.

Enthusiastic Self-Starter: You strive to make a significant impact, taking initiative and driving success from the get-go.

Education:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field.

Work Experience:

7+ years of experience working in a business strategy team with responsibilities including performance analysis, business case development, identifying customer pain points, and defining solutions.

Experience managing high-visibility KPIs in a rapidly evolving environment.

At least 18 years of age
Legally authorized to work in the United States

About the company
ITsutra is an independent IT consultancy. We deliver software development, consulting and training services.

We are passionate about our clients’ problems and we bring a fierce focus to get the job done right, every time. By sharing our knowledge and understanding our clients’ businesses, we deliver the right results for them.

In this IT oriented business world, we clearly felt the necessity of technical support services for our customers, and thus, we started our consultancy services.

Higginbotham, a privately held, independent insurance and financial services firm that ranks within the top 20 nationwide, has an immediate opening for a Business Analyst in our Fort Worth, TX office.

The Business Process Analyst’s role is to elicit, analyze, specify, and validate the business needs of all IT-related business, financial, and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. This includes researching and analyzing data in support of business functions, process knowledge, and systems requirements. The Business Process Analyst is also responsible for proactively generating and compiling reports based on his or her findings, complete with recommended improvements to – or new requirements for – business processes and operational procedures. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of IT system investments and to assist in implementing new computer systems.

Essential Tasks:

Chart existing business processes in order to define current business activities for the development of procedures and models.
Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals
Research, review, and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing and potential trouble areas in operating systems or procedures for partners.
Develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging existing processes.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives for improving processes in operating systems across the organization.
Identify and establish scope and parameters of process analysis in order to define impact, outcome criteria, and measure-taking actions.
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.
Effectively communicates to the project team and key stakeholders, both verbally and written.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Strong work ethic

Our mission is to enhance well-being by connecting individuals with vital health resources through a compassionate workforce that embodies the spirit of neighbors helping neighbors.

HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.

The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise.

Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents

Performs quality assurance
Defines reporting and alerting requirements
Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
Maintains documentation in CRM tool
Regular and predictable attendance
Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
Other duties as may be assigned

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.

As the Senior Business Analyst - CPQ, you will form partnerships with business users across departments and build expertise that will help you prioritize, gather, and document Oracle CPQ requirements related to new configurable product launches, current configurable product updates, continuous improvement initiatives, and clarifying requirements to implement bug fixes.

Who We Want

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders, senior management, and their teams.

What You Will Do

Requirements gathering, testing, and documentation of Oracle CPQ Product Configuration, Commerce, Document Designer, and Pricing Functions focusing on the addition of new product lines to an existing Oracle CPQ Cloud implementation, documenting Sales Bill of Material requirements and Manufacturing Bill of Material requirements.
Work with business department stakeholders, prioritizes enhancement requests related to Oracle CPQ and SAP Variant Configurator.
Consult with Sales, Marketing, Production, and R&D Project managers on specific product line needs.
Learn Stryker’s implementation of Oracle CPQ and becomes a subject matter expert of CPQ end user functionality.
Review upcoming Oracle CPQ Cloud version release notices and collaborates with the CPQ development team to document the required changes.
Collaborate with internal developers and external consultants to create project plans and participate in unit testing and End User Testing.
Lead business process mapping and requirements gathering sessions with business stakeholders.
Work with middleware teams to document interfaces in and out of CPQ in clear and concise business language.
Track CPQ project progress and reports status, issues, and roadblocks to the responsible R&D project manager for a new product launch.
Share industry best practices around Configure-to-Order systems and business processes.
Drive continuous process improvement activities and initiatives.

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent required.
2+ years of relevant experience.
Knowledge of Product Configuration & Rules, Commerce Process, Document Designer and Pricing functionality of Oracle CPQ Cloud or other CPQ systems required.
Experience developing Oracle CPQ Configurators is preferred but not required.
Experience administering Oracle CPQ (formerly BigMachines) preferred.
Experience building manufacturing bills of material using SAP Variant Configurator preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of commercial processes and manufacturing processes including Assemble-to-Order and the differentiation between Sales BOMs and Manufacturing BOMs preferred.
Knowledge of Oracle CPQ integrations with Salesforce.com, Model N and SAP S/4 preferred.

What You Will Do

As the Lead Analyst, you will support and lead (certain areas) management within the Global Inventory COE for all business areas (O&S, MSNT, Europe, international or GQO). Your primary role will be supporting the reporting structure of inventory which includes having an understanding of information need and report creations, the flow of information through the different ERP’s and other reporting/information systems, advanced analytics reporting, variance analysis reporting, and forecasting (reporting). Additionally, you will provide support for all stakeholder management, in leading all inventory related business support reporting, like month end cycles, including all Flash call reporting support, Balance Sheet reviews reporting, Cash Flow reporting, projections/budget cycles reporting, and any business initiatives related to optimizing inventory reporting, supporting transitions of accounting or inventory work reporting, or system implementations. You will not manage any direct reports.

Business Support reporting:

Leading to inform the manager and directors for identifying and defining all reporting needs to precisely and effectively report on metrices, KPI’s, variances and progress for Global Inventory COE

Reporting could entail consolidated overviews for the divisions, Business review slides, flash comment files, PowerBi, Metrics, KPI’s, Balance reviews, cash flow reviews, projections, budgets, regular balances and trends overviews across divisions, progress reports, updating databases and translate needs into report, etc.

Leading the manager and director(s) on the distribution of reports within the organization.

Leading for making the reports accurate, timely and relevant (reconciled).

Analyze and forecast financial, economic and other data to provide accurate and timely information for strategic and operational decisisions.

Support on possible ad hoc analysis and reports

Leading the production of periodic reports

As Lead Analyst you execute many of the same activities as the manager for certain topics, divisions

Develop

Support in development and maintain dashboard and report documentation

Support in developing automated tools and visualizations to provide real-time insights to business data

Support in developing governance process with notifications and guidance to developers and leaders

Assist in simplifying current way of working for sharing information in a more efficient way

Evaluate and quantify value of new features and functionality to support on development

Leading on process improvements and scalable solutions

Leverage industry research and analysis

Leverage reporting templates

Month end reporting:

Driving the monthly closing reporting leading to the comments on actuals and where possible any deviations towards projections/budget with Divisional Finance, Operations, Supply Chain and Global Finance Service Centers (GFS) teams

Communication/relationships:

Communicate timely value added insights to stakeholders/managers

Proactively communicate changes in business trends, local business decisions or other issues that may have a financial impact and are accounting related

Informing and aligning with other departments within Stryker who are also working on reporting including Artificial Intelligence, predictive procedures and other methodologies

Assist in prioritizing IT requests reporting request

Conduct and document complex financial analysis projects

Develop analysis of economic indicators in order to prepare forecasts and analyze the company's short, medium, and long term position; Prepare in-depth evaluations of plans and identify new methods of analysis and presentation for inventory purpose

Attend knowledge and training sessions for reporting requirements as they evolve

Support in building change management plans for reporting

Planning/analyze:

Lead the planning process in reporting with the internal Inventory COE team for the divisions on preparing forecast models, consolidations, and coordination of projection calls where applicable

Provide quality data into business projections and budget processes

Advice team with regards to patterns and relationships in the data

Analyze system data proactively to identify bottleneck, trends and compliance risks.

Compliance:

Support where needed/applicable for Internal and External Audits (mainly SOX related)

Support in accuracy and consistency of data base information and formatting

Support in achieving accuracy and meeting pre determined deadlines

Support in standard reporting pack is relevant, accurate, reliable and timely

Other:

Support in process improvements (use of BOTS/RPA/Alterix/Others)

Participate in inventory reporting project related items and actively deliver input, such as, further integrations, transitions, and system implementations

Support in ad-hoc questions related to inventory business support

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance or equivalent is required (Master’s preferred)

4+ years experience in managing complex reporting environments, preferably within inventory and/or other complex accounting functions in global organizations

Fluent in English

Other languages such as Spanish/Polish/Dutch are nice to have

Excellent working knowledge & understanding of systems, programming, SQL, reporting tools, PowerBi, Excel

The Lead level will also typically: possess well developed knowledge and skills to interpret financial information on costs, prices, expenses and revenues and make recommendations to senior management

Should have the ability to see the ‘big picture’ and yet able to resolve day to day issues if required

Oracle/SAP/MFG/JDE experience is a nice to have.

$73,100 - $152,400 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

IT Business Analyst

EIS is one of the most highly regarded environmental remediation and demolition firms in the U.S. EIS is ranked among Engineering News Record's Top 20 Firms for Asbestos Abatement and in the Top Specialty Contractors. More information can be found at www.EISholdings.com.

Essential Functions:

The IT Business Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting business requirements and translating them into functional specifications for IT solutions. They work closely with stakeholders from various areas of the company to ensure that technology solutions align with business goals and objectives.

The Business Analyst will play an essential role in improving our business processes, driving efficiency, and implementing new system solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Requirements Gathering:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their needs and document detailed business requirements.
Conduct interviews, surveys, and workshops to elicit and prioritize requirements.
Analyze existing processes and systems to identify areas for improvement.

2. Documentation:

Create clear and concise documentation, including business requirement documents, functional requirement documents, use cases, and user stories.
Develop process flow diagrams, data models, and system diagrams to illustrate the proposed solutions.

3. Analysis:

Evaluate the feasibility of proposed solutions and assess potential risks and impacts.
Perform cost-benefit analysis to determine the ROI of proposed projects.
Identify and recommend alternative solutions when necessary.

4. Communication:

Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and IT teams, facilitating communication and understanding.
Ensure that all stakeholders are informed about project progress and changes.
Present findings and recommendations to management and project teams.

5. Testing and Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with the business to develop test plans and test cases based on business requirements.
Participate in user acceptance testing and ensure that the delivered solutions meet business requirements.

6. Training and Support:

Provide level two support for EIS business systems.
Develop training programs and materials and conduct user classroom training as needed.

7. Change Management:

Assist in developing change management strategies and plans to ensure smooth adoption of new technology solutions.

8. Continuous Improvement:

Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions and recommend enhancements or adjustments.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to provide innovative solutions.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or equivalent years of experience.
Minimum of 3 years experience as a Business Analyst or similar role in a project-based organization.
Prior experience with Acumatica is preferred.
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Travel:

This role requires regular travel to the company's multiple facilities approximately 40% of the time.

We offer a dynamic collaborative work environment with a benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, paid time off, paid holiday's and a 401(k) plan.

Job Summary: The Headless CMS Business Analyst is responsible for understanding and translating business needs and requirements into effective solutions using headless content management systems (CMS). They work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that content management processes are efficient, scalable, and aligned with organizational goals. The role involves analyzing, documenting, and implementing CMS strategies and configurations to support content delivery across various channels and devices.

Bachelor's degree in business, information technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a business analyst in the context of headless CMS implementations.
Strong understanding of content management concepts and technologies.
Familiarity with various headless CMS platforms (e.g., Contentful, Strapi, Sanity, etc.).
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Knowledge of content modeling, taxonomies, and content strategies is a plus.
Project management skills are beneficial.
The Headless CMS Business Analyst plays a critical role in ensuring that the organization's content management and delivery align with business goals and user expectations. About the Role

The BI Analyst plays a crucial role in analyzing business data, creating reports, and developing dashboards that help make data-driven decisions.





A Day in the Life

Make a significant impact on our business decisions by providing valuable insights through data analysis of large datasets.
Collaborate with various departments within the company to identify and analyze areas of potential revenue growth.
Provide analytical insights (quantitative and qualitative) from internal and external datasets to support business function decisions.
Develop and maintain KPIs, scheduled reports, dashboards and reporting for data integrity.
Clearly and precisely present complex information and viable recommendations to stakeholders, including the C-Suite; translate data into actionable insights.
Collect and analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights to drive business objectives.
Develop and implement statistical models to solve business problems.
Collaborate with relevant EWC departments to understand their data needs, provide recommendations to improve processes, and drive growth with data-based decision-making.
Identify opportunities to implement predictive analytics and machine learning algorithms to drive decision-making.
Develop and implement research methodologies to inform/enhance data-driven business decisions.
Stay up-to-date on industry best practices and emerging trends in analytics and data science.





What Sets You Apart

Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Self-starter with a proven ability to facilitate corporate data-driven decision capabilities using effective data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large data sets and experience visualizing them.
Ability to investigate data to explain anomalies, troubleshoot issues and partner with the business teams as needed.
Demonstrated ability to manage analytical projects from requirement gathering to presentation and reporting.
Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and how to apply them to large datasets.
Knowledge of earned value management, cost-benefit, what-if, project performance, and business project analysis.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations, plus has the ability to translate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.





Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, computer science, information mgmt.., etc.).
3+ years of proven proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g. Domo, Tableau, Power BI, Looker); creating impactful dashboards.
3+ years of retail or service-base Franchise data analysis.

Job Title: External Reporting – Business Analyst - Senior Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


As a Product Delivery Senior Associate on the External Reporting team you will be responsible for analyzing large sets of loan level data, evaluating and translating reporting instructions into sound and quality data, improving analytical review process, maintaining documentations on change control procedures. This position is primarily responsible for gathering, interpreting, and managing reporting requirements for external regulatory institutions (FDIC, FRB, OCC, etc.). This is a hands-on role with a great potential for career growth. We are looking for an individual with unique combination of strong technical (SQL) and interpersonal skills to drive the continuous data improvement. This role will work collaboratively with both internal team members and a wide range of partners from Home Lending Business, Technology, MIS and risk.

Job Responsibilities

Deep dive analysis of the data to ensure accuracy of reporting
Comfortable analyzing large data sets and conducting root cause analysis to understand and remediate reporting anomalies
Responsible for detailed documentation of Requirements/Requirement interpretation
Conduct data research to triage issues, identify root cause and recommend solutions to fix data defects
Work with other teams (IT, CCB Data Management & Risk etc.) to identify data issues and improve data quality for CCAR files and to effectively update logic during system conversions / decommissions as well as new acquisitions
Preparation of various reporting metrics for inclusion in presentations to Steering Committee and Management

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics or related area
3+ years of Mortgage/Banking/finance analytical support experience
Strong SQL skills
Experience with delivering solutions through agile methodologies and new technologies
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills
Strong working knowledge of MS Excel and advanced data manipulation functions (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, ODBC, VBA)
Direct experience with Home Lending servicing system (MSP) to perform loan level review to determine RCA to assist in the remediation of Reporting discrepancies

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills

Exposure to Python, Tableau and Alteryx

Required soft skills

Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills are critical
Works well collaboratively and independently in an ever-changing business environment

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) within BCG's Consumer Practice Area, you will work in a growing global team, providing restaurant industry expertise and insights whilst working together with case and proposal teams to provide knowledge assets, analysis and expert advisory. You’ll serve as a thought partner and content expert to case teams and topic/sector leaders, helping structure and solve complex issues.

Additionally, you will support your topic in developing existing & new intellectual property and knowledge assets. You will work on commercialization efforts for the topic/sector, in conjunction with business leaders, supporting marketing efforts, conferences and publications. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst you will assist with on-boarding, training and guiding junior colleagues and share best practices within the team.

BCG’s Consumer Practice is one of the firm's largest industry practice areas and keeps growing continuously across all regions. BCG’s Consumer practice creates breakthrough innovations for clients in four sub-sectors: consumer goods, retail, and fashion & luxury.

YOU'RE GOOD AT


Ability to work autonomously and with a strong entrepreneurial thinking spirit. Communicating with senior stakeholders, in a credible and confident way
Working collaboratively and effectively in a group dynamic often virtual, proficient in agile ways of working
Flexibility and bringing a curious and creative mindset, open to new things and able to propose innovative ideas

YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)


1-2+ years of consulting experience in restaurant, foodservice, consumer packaged goods or retail industry required; candidates with consulting experience preferred
In lieu of consulting experience, 2+ years minimum consumer industry experience required with preference in:
Experience at top QSR, Fast Casual and Casual Dining players in a corporate role or a Restaurant Technology/Startup organization in roles focused on growth strategy, franchise development, business analytics, artificial intelligence or digitalization/automation of the employee and customer experience, loyalty, personalization, etc.

Experience in advanced analytics, cross-industry data and expertise development focused on consumer topics

Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills to interact with internal and external stakeholder while working in a global collaborative team environment

YOU'LL WORK WITH

As a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up of a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight.

BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients.

Job Title: MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst
Job Description:
MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst

We are searching for…
MBA talent passionate about making lives better. Axxess is a leading technology innovator for healthcare at home focused on solving the most complex industry challenges. As a member of our team, you will collaborate and present innovative health solutions that have a global impact. As an emerging leader you will be exposed to Axxess’ business processes on teams such as Product, Marketing, Finance, Engineering and Client Experience to name a few. You deliver creative solutions, while leading challenging projects connected to our Axxess’ business objectives. This opportunity is for MBA professionals with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, build professional skills and advance a global career. Join us as a Associate Business Analyst.

What you will experience...
A one-year program, designed to provide professional development for career growth and advancement
Mentorship and engagement with senior leadership across the business
Global experience, to include a two-week residency in global markets
Deployment to an Axxess team upon successful completion of the rotational program
A fast-paced, collaborative team-oriented environment that encourages everyone to bring their authentic self to work every day
Competitive compensation with full selection of benefits, including company-matching 401k contributions and 20 days of paid time off + holidays + birthdays
Who we are…
It’s simple. We do business differently, by empowering our team to create fresh ideas which impact lives everywhere. We don’t just dream it; we do it every day at Axxess, we bring life-changing technology to healthcare impacting the way people work, learn, and grow their business. Our edge does not come from our technology, it comes from our people. We work as one team with a common goal to create shared success benefiting everyone.

What you will do…
Develop creative solutions to challenging issues
Gain knowledge and understanding of industry trends, KPI’s and analysis and the overall competitive landscape
Engage with our partners and clients to identify challenges and develop marketing strategies, adoption and of solutions
Develop partnerships in emerging markets
Manage project schedules and communicate risk to stakeholders

What do you bring...
Currently, pursuing an MBA from a college or university, with a graduation date in 2023 or May 2024
Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university (3.3 minimum GPA, preferred)
Demonstrated success with a minimum of two years of post-baccalaureate professional work experience
High level of business and global acumen
Ability to travel domestically and internationally
Exemplified leadership on previous projects
Collaborative with a learning mindset and desire for continuous improvement

You are better prepared if you…
Possess passion about increasing access to quality healthcare globally
Have contributed to high-performing teams or organizations
Lead strategic planning and implementation
Desire an exciting experience in a rapidly growing privately held company

MBA Timeline:
Apply - November 2023 - January 2024
Interview -
February 2024
Final selection -
March 2024
Axxess orientation -
June 5, 2024
Global office visit -
Spring 2025
Deployment to Axxess team -
June 2025
Axxess is an equal opportunity employer and drug-free workplace. All applicants must be authorized to work in and currently reside in the United States. We offer a competitive compensation package (DOE), benefits and growth opportunities for everyone who joins Axxess!

Our Teller Development team is seeking a Senior Business/Quality Analyst position to join our team. This position will work with the software development team to create software requirements, as well as the research, testing, and solutions of the teller software. Interacts with business units to gather system requirements and convey business requirements.

Agile/Scrum experience.
Programming experience with C# and Selenium.

Chalk Mountain Services of Texas, LLC (“Chalk”) is a leader in transportation and logistics servicing the oil and gas extraction industry. The Company is based in Fort Worth, TX and is currently hiring an Operations Data Analyst.

The Data Analyst will provide enhanced management reports and a high-quality budgeting and forecasting analysis. They will utilize technical expertise to ensure data is accurate and high-quality. Data is then analyzed and presented in a way that identifies errors, irregularities, and opportunities for financial and operational improvement so to assist the business in making better decisions.

Responsibilities

REPORTING:

· Develop financial and management reports which clearly and concisely illustrate operational, financial, and forensic performance. Continue to enhance reporting as requirements change.

Maintain and distribute the various reporting package templates for management and operational personnel.
Assist CFO in the presentation of findings in monthly board reports and other presentations.
Prepare ad hoc reports as required.

PLANNING:

Assist with the development and ongoing measurement of Key Performance Indicators utilized to measure operational performance and incentive bonus calculations.
Create forecasting models based upon historical data and pertinent forecast data designed to project Key Performance Indicators and other critical assumptions used in the Company’s forecasting process.
Provide additional support for the annual/monthly forecasting process.

ANALYSIS:

Review business performance data on a continuous basis. Identify errors and irregularities in the data and identify opportunities for improvement in operational and financial performance in such data. Such efforts include but are not limited to:
Development of metric forecasts and subsequent variance analysis.
Drill down analysis of data and metrics designed to identify underlying relationships between operational behavior and results.
Analysis of resource capacity utilization
Analyze payroll and benefits trends, coordinate with Payroll and Human Resources to ensure accurate payroll reporting.
Periodic auditing of internal functions through assessment of processed data.

OTHER:

Such other assignments as the Company may require from time to time.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential function satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

Education & Experience

Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance or Data Analysis required. Proven analytical depth and strong technical skills required, including current knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles. Experience with Vena, Planful or similar CPM software considered a plus. Proficiency with MS Office, including Excel (Pivot Table and V-Look ups) and PowerPoint required.

Strong ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines. Strong analytical problem-solving aptitude with creative solutions, ability to organize work with large amounts of information efficiently, manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously with attention to detail.

Communication

Ability to communicate effectively and professionally, both in writing and verbally, with management, vendors, consultants, and other business partners. Ability to speak effectively in group settings.

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies – ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization

Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred
