Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

ServiceNow Business Analyst

Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology, a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below:

The Team
The HR Transformation team is a core component of our Human Capital practice; the work we do supports the five major issues our clients are facing. We collaborate with our clients to develop leading global HR strategies and support organizations in achieving excellence through implementing solutions that transform how they organize, develop capabilities, deploy leading technology, and deliver a leading employee experience.
Keeping the employee in mind, all our services cater to improving an organization's productivity through their human capital asset. The client issues we work with range from the need for a comprehensive HR strategy, to determining the need for new and enabling technologies, to streamlining HR operations and transforming the way HR is delivered.

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities
As a ServiceNow Business Analyst for our HR Transformation team, you will utilize your knowledge and experience of ServiceNow to support Deloitte's Human Capital Consulting ServiceNow team. In this role you will be responsible for:

Working closely with the client's business function to design and implement a target state process
General support, administration, and maintenance of ServiceNow platform and associated applications
Assess existing artifacts, documentation, and data to baseline client performance against best practices
Oversee business process assessment, target state design, and road map activities
Conduct design and discovery sessions with clients, gather business requirements, and translate into user stories for development team
ServiceNow configuration, integrations, and business rule creation
Coordinate and provide guidance to the development team
Create test cases and contribute in-unit testing and integrated unit testing
Conduct demos of out-of-the-box capabilities and new functionalities of ServiceNow Platform
Work closely with project team to support ServiceNow implementation
Provide technical oversight and ensure the design is accurately translated into a functional solution
Design and oversee integration of ServiceNow with third party system and automate business processes
Monitor health, usage, and overall compliance of ServiceNow and its applications
Negotiate what is expected to be configured out-of-the box or customized
Enable the adoption of new processes, procedures, and tool

Qualifications Required

2+ years of ServiceNow experience in an enterprise environment
Strong understanding of ServiceNow Platform capabilities
Experience with out-of-the-box client scripts, update set creation, and deployment process
Experience and understanding of Agile methodologies
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline, or comparable experience
Must be technically savvy and possess strong experience configuring ServiceNow
Familiar with Service Oriented architecture and web service integration (SOAP, WSDL, REST)
Experience conducting design and discovery sessions with clients, gathering requirements, and translating into user stories for development team
Hands on experience in ServiceNow configurations, flow designers, integrations, and business rule creation
Experience working with ATF
Experience in ServiceNow reporting & dashboards
Travel up to 10% annually
A current government security clearance, or the ability to hold a clearance is required
No Sponsorship: be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Job Title: SOC Insider Threat Hunter, Operations Analyst (C12)
Job Description:
About Citi:

Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.


As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services.


Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.

The Team:

The Insider Threat Hunting Ops (ITHO) team sits in the SOC actively monitoring Citi's network against malicious attempts to harm the organization utilizing cybersecurity tools and trend analysis.

The Role:

The SOC Insider Threat Hunting Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for leading efforts to prevent, monitor and respond to information/data breaches and cyber-attacks. The overall objective of this role is to ensure the execution of Information Security directives and activities in alignment with Citi's data security policy.

Responsibilities:

Monitor and analyze logs and alerts on a variety of different technologies across multiple platforms to identify security incidents
Proactively hunt for insider threat utilizing large datasets, tools, and detections
Continually assess and refine insider threat detections
Execute analysis of email-based threats to include understanding of email communications, platforms, headers, transactions, and identification of malicious tactics, techniques, and procedures
Utilize a variety of security tools and technologies to analyze potential threats to determine impact, scope, and recovery
Utilize strong analytical and problem-solving skills to detect and respond to insider threats effectively
Leverage network security tools and capabilities to support Cyber Threat Monitoring activities
Assist Security Incident Response Teams with incident investigations and aid in technical risk assessments
Identify and develop new and improved technical procedures and process control manuals
Identify significant IS threats and vulnerabilities
Perform regular assessments based on changes in the threat landscape as needed
Appropriately assess and prioritize risk
Maintain a strong code of ethics and respecting privacy while investigating insider Threat related incidents is essential

Qualifications:

3+ years' hands-on relevant experience working in a SOC/application security role or equivalent experience
Cybersecurity experience is an absolute requirement
Strong experience working with DLP tools, UEBA, and SIEM technologies
Strong proficiency with threat analysis tools
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Strong working knowledge of Threat Monitoring Procedures
Knowledge and exposure in creating use cases
Direct experience working with large datasets
Hands-on experience in threat hunting in a corporate environment
Proven analytical skills
Knowledge and exposure to SOAR technology highly preferred
Scripting/coding experience is a big plus
Previous experience as an insider threat analyst and/or threat hunter preferred

Education:

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience required
Certifications: CISA, CISSP, ITPM (Insider Threat Program Manager), SANs

Job Summary

This position is an ideal role for an experienced ERP professional looking to join a fast-paced team where they can make a difference each day. The Business Analyst (SAP) will work with the business process owners to implement and develop end-to-end business processes to support the core organizational goals and functions. The Business Analyst will recommend solutions for meeting these needs and implement solutions in the most efficient and timely manner. This person will have an active role in Go Live events as well as new module implementation projects. This role is roughly 75% functional and 25% technical.

Job Responsibilities

Support bi-annual road mapping / planning efforts with a multi-year perspective addressing needs and contributing to operating budgets.
Assist leadership in prioritizing work requests, enhancements, and other initiatives, as necessary.
Provide project management as well as an active role in requirements gathering, testing and hyper-care activities for all IT initiatives
Implement business process changes and enhancements for existing business processes.
Develop test scenarios and scripts as well as coordinate and perform end-to-end system integration testing.
Collaborate with both internal resources as well as partners that may be onshore or offshore.
Analyze current business needs, anticipate future needs, and provide solutions integrating various business operations.
Diagnose problems through discussions with users and coordinate with internal and external support teams to resolve problems.
Monitor project progress by tracking activity, problem resolution, publishing progress reports, and recommend actions.
May be asked to participate in acquisition assessments and integration.
Participate in audits and provide support as needed
Other duties as assigned

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, business management or supply chain. MBA preferred.
5+ years' experience in a Business Analyst role with 2+ years' experience with SAP R/3 and /or S/4 HANA in a functional support role, preferably from the manufacturing or distribution industry required. However, experience with another ERP system outside of SAP may apply.
Experience across SAP Modules (Procurement, Sales & Distribution, Manufacturing, EWM, and Finance).
Experience in SAP's Analytics Cloud, Analysis for Office, Quality Management or Plant Maintenance is a plus.
Ability to communicate technical concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively with staff, at all levels, and third parties.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Candidate will be remote but travel as needed per project demands for hyper care and/or support.

Work Conditions

Remote role close to a major airport hub with ability to travel up to 75% domestically on a regular basis for support.

The Role : Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools

The Team :
The Agile & PPM Tools team is responsible for developing and managing enterprise tools enabling Agile Execution (Azure DevOps), Project Portfolio Management (Solution Business Manager) and Reporting (Tableau), for all the S&P Global Divisions. These tools are used across S&P for Portfolio Management capabilities like prioritizing, executing and tracking Portfolios, Agile Workflow Execution to enable Agile delivery and Portfolio & Agile Analytics.

The Impact :
Are you looking for an opportunity to advance your career as an innovative enterprise team member? The Agile & PPM Tools Team is looking for an innovative professional who can bring teamwork, creativity, and business analyst experience to a global team.

What’s in it for you :
As a Business Analyst, Agile & PPM Tools, you will have the opportunity to work closely with senior stakeholders from all the divisions and showcase your ability to tackle multiple assignments with ease and gracefully absorb changes as they present themselves. Overall goal of the Team is to develop and support a common Enterprise toolset for all divisions to enable Portfolio Management, resourcing, execution, and reporting with cutting edge technologies like Azure DevOps, AWS Cloud Systems (S3, EC2, RDS etc), AWS Services (Lambda, Glue, S3, Redshift etc), Databricks as well as Market leaders in PPM and Agile tools.

Responsibilities :
In the day-to-day operations, you will be a part of the Agile & PPM Tools Scrum team and will support our internal customers which include users from across the S&P Global Enterprise at all levels from senior leadership to individual users. You will also facilitate communication between our users and our Business and Scrum team members who manage and deliver solutions on these platforms. With your acute investigation, troubleshooting and communication skills, you will be championing support best practices and improving our user’s experience. Some of your areas of ownership will include:

Agile & PPM Tools Engineering Team (Scrum Team):
Support our customers on the requests raised by them on our ticketing platform - Service Now
Troubleshoot and service customer requests focusing on maximum customer satisfaction
Liaison with end customer to Support and advance tools adoption.
Share knowledge with peers and foster a cohesive self-organized team environment
Provide feedback to help the Business and Development teams to create high-value products
Escalates and tracks issues with appropriate levels within the team
Build a deep understanding of the solutions delivered on both platforms to understand utility from our users/customers perspective
Keep up to date on support and customer experience best practices and suggest or implement improvements in processes or tools

What We’re Looking For :
Basic Qualifications :

Overview:

We are seeking a Sales Analyst who will work closely with our National Account and Lighting Retail sales teams. As the Sales Analyst for Arteriors, you will be responsible for analyzing sales data and providing actionable insights to optimize product performance and drive revenue growth across our key domestic retail partners. This role will enable business transformation by creating a data-driven, insight-based culture throughout our e-commerce channels, Lighting Showroom, and National accounts.


The ideal candidate will excel in developing internal systems and processes that assist our business partners in maximizing their revenue potential with the Arteriors brand. Additionally, the ideal candidate for this role is highly analytical and organized, understands an omni-channel business model with experience in retail reporting, and has a passion for analyzing large datasets.


What began over 35 years ago as a boutique accessories company has evolved into a global force in the design industry. With premier lighting, furniture and accessories, Arteriors redefines interior spaces through unexpected creativity and meticulous craftsmanship. Pursuit of innovation drives us forward. Our imagination never rests. And thanks to our uniquely diverse and talented employee base, we are inspired to continue the remarkable journey. Arteriors embraces creativity in all its forms, from products and ideas to inventive, curious employees who think of themselves as tastemakers rather than followers. Innovation is impossible without our diverse team and their ideas, so we focus on creating a diverse workplace that promotes employee differences and creates an inclusive culture. Our aim is to provide our team members with an equitable experience.


Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Insights:
Conduct competitive analysis to identify market trends, benchmark against competitors, and recommend strategies to gain a competitive edge.
Translate complex data sets into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Collects and interprets sell-thru data with a proficient understanding of SEO best practices.
Identify patterns and trends in data sets by product category, aesthetic, price point, and other essential product attributes by account.
Maintains iMAP and other online brand integrity and compliance standards.
Collects data and product information from dealers to understand their selling trends.


Coordination and Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Collaborate with marketing, sales, and retail partner teams to develop and execute e-commerce strategies that drive growth and enhance the customer experience on our partners sites.
Supports the sales teams that manage national accounts, lighting e-tailers and lighting showrooms’ online businesses with new item setups and product launches.
Streamline work to simplify processes and procedures across the digital ecosystem to be less manual and optimize efficiency.


Digital Presentation and Data Maintenance:
Prepare and present regular reports and dashboards to communicate findings and insights to cross-functional teams and management.
Create clear and concise data visualizations, graphs, and charts to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Maintain data within online platforms such as XO Lights and Lights America.
This job might be for you if::
5 years’ experience with retail sales data management, preferably in a similar industry (home furnishings, design, or fashion).
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, mathematics, or data analytics is preferred.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting, preferably in a retail or consumer goods environment.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively across teams
Possess a high degree of proficiency with MS Office products, especially with Excel and PowerPoint.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks at various stages simultaneously while meeting deadlines.
What's in it for you::
Medical, dental and vision insurance available the first day of the month after hire date
401k with employer matching
Unlimited Paid Time Off
Paid Volunteer Days, allowing you to give back to your community
9 paid holidays with early release before holidays
Annual bonus potential and merit increase potential
Generous employee discount
Employee referral bonus

Description

This is a unique opportunity to join our fast-growing team in Gartner’s Global Product Management organization. Here you’ll work with a group of data scientists, engineers, UX designers and other product managers to drive significant business impact to client retention. Our mission is to create effortless, customer-centric, habit-forming digital experiences that enable clients to solve their mission critical priorities. The Associate Product Manager plays a critical role in driving analysis, ideation, requirements, and implementation of enhancements to our Client Experience Notifications product, the company’s #1 driver of client digital engagement.

We are looking for an analytic-minded, creative-thinking, impact-driven, self-motivated, data-storytelling problem solver. The successful candidate will assist other product manager teammates with analysis as well as own their own projects. This is an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of our efforts to drive client engagement as well as Gartner’s revenue growth and retention.

What You Will Do

Ideate, size, scope, execute and analyze enhancements to our Client Experience Notifications product suite’s Email Notifications to drive quantifiably impact to client satisfaction and thereby retention rates.
Leverage qualitative feedback from client and partner interviews to uncover user needs through exploratory and focused conversations.
Mine quantitative data to drive insights, inform hypotheses, prioritize development and size opportunity.
Build consensus amongst product leaders, engineering, and business on prioritizing the product roadmap based on client and business value.
Implement a “lean” approach to product development where you – along with your design and engineering teams – strive for early validation of learnings and continuously iterate to achieve our goals.
Direct efforts for email template design, content management, audience building, delivery setup and analysis.
Participate with your scrum team in sprints to build a product roadmap, define MVP functionality, collect user feedback, and analyze the results.

What You Will Need

Bachelor’s degree required; MBA (or equivalent) is a plus.
1+ years of experience working as a business analyst or digital product manager.
Love quantitative/qualitative problem solving and are excited about defining and driving use cases, product features/requirements, roadmaps, and release plans through data.
Experience in gathering input from and communicating ideas to clients and key stakeholders across businesses.
Significant demonstrated fluency in leveraging Excel, Power BI, Tableau or other business intelligence and data visualization tools to drive problem definition, ideation, solutioning and data storytelling.
Experience in writing detailed and thorough requirements documentation in story format is a plus.
Fluency in lean product principles and agile development lifecycle is a plus.
Outstanding project management skills involving internal and external stakeholders with ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads in a fast-paced, detail-oriented, multi-tasking environment.
Strong written and verbal communication and collaboration skills.
Demonstrated history of getting the most out of diverse cross-functional teams across business, UX, data science and technical stakeholders.
Self-starter who can anticipate business needs and fulfill them proactively.
Independent and curious, you set your own targets, ask for help when you need it and are always looking to learn something new.

Summary:

As a Senior Analyst, Data Governance Operations you will play a pivotal role in driving our data governance initiatives forward. Leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will lead meaningful conversations, host trainings, and foster relationships with various teams across the organization. This role offers the chance to work closely with a diverse set of stakeholders, influencing the way data is viewed, managed, and leveraged across the organization. If you're passionate about data and its potential to drive business success, this could be the perfect role for you.

Responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders across different functions to understand and address data-related needs and challenges.
Serve as a key point of contact for data stewards and owners across different domains, assisting with onboarding, addressing queries, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed to effectively manage their domains.
Develop and nurture relationships with various teams, positioning the data governance unit as a reliable partner in all data matters.
Assist in the development and updating of training content and materials; host and facilitate training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding and implementation of data governance practices.
Support ongoing data governance projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with the company's strategic goals.
Assist in maintaining governance documentation, ensuring all processes, policies, and standards are up-to-date and easily accessible for internal teams.
Address data governance related issues, escalating where necessary and ensuring timely resolution.
Support the collection and reporting of data governance metrics, helping to showcase the progress and impact of governance initiatives.

Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Systems, Business Administration) or equivalent experience.


Required qualifications:
Minimum one year of experience supporting data governance operations, data policy, data management, or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to facilitate meetings and training sessions effectively.
Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

Who is Crescent Energy (NYSE: CRGY)?

Strong Cash Flow, Production, Return of Capital, and Balance Sheet.


Who is Contango Resources?

An operating subsidiary (upstream, midstream, and services) of Crescent Energy with ~600 employees and ~50k boe/d with a production mix of ~40% oil, ~40% natural gas, and ~20% NGL’s.
Our operating footprint consists of assets in the Gulf Coast, Permian, Rockies, and Oklahoma.

Overview:
Why GM Financial Operations Support?
Ready to join the revolution in auto finance analytics and business intelligence? Welcome to the "Operations Support Analytics and Reporting" team, where innovation meets expertise, and passion drives progress. With an average employee tenure of an astounding 10 years, our team has honed their skills to perfection, becoming masters of data in the realm of auto finance.

Harnessing the power of Power BI, Microsoft Excel, SAS, and Informatica, we transform raw information into golden insights. But we don't stop there. We're relentless in our pursuit of improvement, constantly seeking out new ways to optimize processes and elevate our game.

With over 1,400 company employees counting on us, along with the thousands of auto dealer employees and owners we support, we take our mission seriously. Our information is the catalyst for decision-making, guiding the way to success. But hey, we don't let the pressure get to us. We're easy-going, lighthearted folks who believe that work and fun go hand in hand.

Join our spirited team, and let's redefine the world of auto finance analytics and business intelligence together. The possibilities are endless, and we're just getting started.
Responsibilities:
About the role:
You are an experienced team member and subject matter expert responsible for developing analysis and reporting tools that solve business and organizational challenges. You will lead the production of data collection, research, and presentation of findings for the loan originations, legal and compliance groups. You have a natural curiosity, attention to detail and a self-starter that can manage tasks and responsibilities with little supervision. You need to be able to communicate effectively with Senior Management by making complex concepts easy to understand. You will use your in-depth knowledge of business intelligence tools and industry experience to solve complex challenges in the interest of achieving company objectives.
Qualifications:
What makes you a dream candidate?
Possess strong understanding and experience in technical systems, datasets, data warehouses, data analysis techniques and data visualization to produce results.
Possess strong knowledge of languages such as Python, SQL, SAS and Power BI, to develop business and operational reporting and data visualizations that enable effective and efficient decision-making.
Maintains thorough understanding of relevant data sources and metrics
Extracts meaningful insights and trends and makes recommendations for various analyses to senior leadership which will improve business performance
Partners with and provides recommendations to business leadership on the appropriate application of analytics to business strategies and effectively communicates analysis
Builds technical knowledge to support research and analytic responsibilities through independent learning
Knowledge of consumer auto lending

Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, MIS, Finance, Economics, Computer Science or a in related field or equivalent work experience dealing with data analysis can be substituted preferred
5+ years in data analysis/reporting or analytical role required
5+ years of previous experience in BI tools and languages such as Power BI, SQL, Python, or SAS required
2+ years in auto finance preferred
What We Offer: Generous benefits package available on day one to include: 401K matching, bonding leave for new parents (12 weeks, 100% paid), tuition assistance, training, GM employee auto discount, community service pay and nine company holidays.
Our Culture: Our team members define and shape our culture — an environment that welcomes innovative ideas, fosters integrity, and creates a sense of community and belonging. Here we do more than work — we thrive.
Compensation: Competitive pay and bonus eligibility
Work Life Balance: Flexible hybrid work environment, 2-days a week in office

Job Title: SAP Sales and Distribution Functional Analyst
Job Description:
it’s what’s inside that counts

_______________________________


There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Day 1 benefits coverage with low cost medical, vision, dental
Paid-time off and vacation starting Day 1
Competitive compensation and bonuses
Company-paid Lifestyle fund, life and disability insurance
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Training and advancement opportunities
Why This Job

CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel industry and grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day in an office cubicle, operating a crane or running the melt shop at one of our mills, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.


Responsible for defi ning, designing, governing, delivering, and supporting SAP centric solutions that enable and enhance the CMCOrder to Cash Process. Build and maintain eff ective relationships with key business stakeholders by off ering guidance andrecommendations as needed to ensure clarity of understanding and alignment of company goals. Partner with various IT teammembers to ensure feasibility, comprehension, and successful delivery of business requirement best practice solutions. Eff ectivelycommunicate and properly manage time providing on-going SAP Sales and Logistics support, including development of business cases,business requirement and process documentation, test scenarios, and training materials. Actively multitask and collaborate within ahigh performing team that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, and promotes continuous learning.

What You'll Do
Analyze and design new business processes for Sales and Logistics business units for a multi-faceted manufacturing industry
Apply technical and functional knowledge to create world-class solution architecture that effectively integrates with the business units’ operations
Build and maintain effective relationships with key business and IT stakeholders
Understand current and future business requirements and strategies for information technology services and systems
Document business needs, distinguish between needs and wants, identify gaps between business needs and standard application functionality
Design and document solutions that fill the gaps, and provide detailed business requirements specifications for developers
Develop, document, and execute test plans to assess the integrity and accuracy of business processes, functional modifications/enhancements, etc
Maintain business process and end user training documentation and deliver training as required
Support, analyze, and resolve production application issues as required
What You'll Need
Five or more years of work experience within the SAP ECC standard Sales, Distribution, and Logistics space
Five or more years of experience as an SAP business or functional analyst
Advanced time management and analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Motivated self-starter that can work effectively with minimal supervision
Ability to multitask and collaborate in a functional, technical, multidiscipline, high performing team to plan and meet aggressive deadlines
Experience with and knowledgeable of Transportation and Fleet Management
Experience with TMW, SQL, and Microsoft Applications preferred
Experience delivering projects in an agile environment preferred
Experience in the industrial manufacturing and/or process industry preferred
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills, with an ability to use appropriate analysis and logic when solving problems
Ability to maintain awareness and knowledge of relevant, existing and emerging technologies and the impact they have on CMC business operations
Results oriented with focus on achieving both short and long term goals in fluid environment
Your Education
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or related discipline with an IT focus is preferred
An advanced degree is preferred

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.


If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

Overview:

The primary focus of this role would be to support Team Lead and Sr. Manager in all activities related to device deployments and operations of the Deployment and Repair Centers in US and Canada. This is an analyst role that is dual in nature. It consists of responsibilities related to site operations that are physical in nature as well as responsibilities related to Life Cycle Management projects, processes and support.




The Analyst would support all Life Cycle Processes related to assets (existing and new) in purview of the Mobility and End User Devices Group. This includes but is not limited to iOS devices, rugged devices, mobile printers, laptops and desktops, warehouse scanners and other assets. The analyst would be accountable to assist driving successful delivery from MSP Contractors and other stakeholders related to device repair, business as usual device request and project deployments. They would need to maintain site operations while also being a key deployment project, inventory and device management contributor.


The role would support their Team Lead and Sr, Manager by participating in and driving seamless device deployments, tracking all cost, working with all stakeholders to handle project and site billing, cost and cross charges. The role would also be responsible for development and updating project files and trackers using Excel and other project management and metric capturing tools. This Analyst would work with additional departments and vendors included but not limited to Facilities, disposal partners, repair vendors, third party vendors, accessory and supply vendors, Telecom Expense Management Team, Finance, business stakeholders, IT and other functional partners.




The selected candidate would be required to be on-site mainly at the Carrollton Deployment & Repair Center (CDRC) at 2853 Eisenhower St. Ste. 200 Carrollton, TX 75007 but will also be required to periodically work at Plano HQ.




We are expecting eleven major projects in 2024 in addition to baseline responsibilities. These projects are steady and will continue yearly. This Analyst would be key support in enduring success.



Responsibilities:
Own end to end operations and support of Carrollton and Canada Deployment and repair facilities
Drive deployment work intake, prioritization and release timing; balancing demand and available resources
Ensure adherence to Finance, Procurement, Legal and other functional rules and guidance related to life cycle management
Work with vendors and partners driving repair, operations and continuous improvement
Support delivery of SOW and Contracts
Support development and delivery of continuously improving KPIs, Metrics, other reporting
Key project stakeholder and contributor working with business partners and other functional stakeholders
Support and drive “warehouse activities” including but not limited to site upkeep, repairs, and proper inventory and operations processes
Maintain stellar, positive and collaborative work environment
Leverage onshore and offshore resources for efforts related to repair and Mobile Device Life Cycle Management
Qualifications:
1-2 Years Project Delivery
1-2 Years in Asset Life Cycle Support
1-2 Working with physical (warehouse) as well as project/business related deliverables
Non Tech Skills
Proven track record working with multiple internal and external stakeholders
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Collaboration and listening skills.
Ability to lead and drive discussions managing upward
Ability to manage highly visible competing priorities
Competencies
Key project contributor
Exceptional MS Office Skills a must!
Excel Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPS, Basic Graphs

Position Summary

The Director of Business Intelligence is a key member of the technology leadership team and serves as the Company’s analytics thought leader. This leader will develop, plan, and implement a technology strategy that delivers optimal returns on investment in coordination with the organization’s goals and core values with a focus on a “customer service” orientation.

Areas of responsibility include strategic leadership, team management, technical leadership around data management / ETL processes, end user reporting and analytics needs as well as project prioritization and management.

The Director will bring a track record of success in setting the strategic data and analytics direction in a multi-unit, franchised enterprise by driving innovation and building a competitive advantage based on strategic information.

The role is located in Addison, TX and this role requires the ability to be present in the office at least three days per week.




Key objectives

Lead the Business Intelligence team through data integration, storage, reporting, analytics, monitoring and compliance phases
Guide information strategy for customer, finance, marketing and other key data areas
Build and maintain Franchisee relationships; Earn respect of franchisees and cultivate strong relationships; navigate challenging situations with professionalism and confidence
Offer creative and practical solutions; Utilize creativity and innovation in problem solving and applying appropriate methodologies relevant to the complexity of the challenge
Understand future opportunities; Closely monitor changes with data technologies and identify ways the company can improve and implement plans to achieve these objectives
Maintain a high performing team; Continually assess and lead a talented, flexible, high performing BI function that has a high sense of urgency, is customer oriented, is responsive, and communicates effectively and manage the organization with a lean, ‘player / coach’ approach

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & DESIRED OUTCOMES




Serve as the thought leader, business partner and team mentor for the full data & analytics lifecycle

Collaborate with leadership to identify opportunities for leveraging data to gain a competitive advantage
Develop and execute the business intelligence strategy aligned with the organization's goals and objectives
Lead and manage BI team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities to team members
Own BI‐related budgeting, planning and procurement, including developing business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for spending and initiatives
Oversee data integration processes, ensuring the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from various sources to maintain a reliable data infrastructure
Ensure data pipelines are efficient, scalable, and maintain data integrity while optimizing priorities, delivery speed and related value-based spend
Ensure that data and analytics practices comply with relevant data protection and privacy regulations and security standards and protocols
Own and drive support processes around data / BI platforms, with an eye towards continuous improvement



IDEAL EXPERIENCE

Experience as BI/Analytics Director at a high growth company with a proven track record of high impact

Track-record of building and leading highly effective BI teams with a customer service and partnering mindset
Experience building strong stakeholder relationships across departments
Depth of experience selecting and implementing suitable technology for efficient data loading, governance and reporting capabilities required
Experience in building at a metrics-driven company (especially Private Equity owned) is ideal



PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS

Driving Results

Organized, urgent, and accountable: gets stuff done
Highly analytical mind-set; ROI and data-driven decision maker; has strong problem-solving and conceptual skills with the ability to quickly analyze and synthesize to support informed decision-making
Sets continually higher goals that are ambitious but realistic for self and team, geared to organizational objectives

Collaborating and Influencing

Presents effectively and persuasively with composure, building trust and credibility with various audiences
Excellent project management skills with the ability to balance multiple priorities and key stakeholders
Ability to work across the organization to get buy-in from the whole team on important initiatives and holds people accountable for results

Leading People

Collaborates and openly debates with the team to manage projects, solve problems, discuss challenging issues or learn more about critical issues as a group
Periodically reviews team progress against plans, focuses attention beyond the project to the full year and beyond



QUALIFICATIONS

15+ years of experience as BI/Analytics leader at growth companies with a proven track record of high impact
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Strategic thinking and the ability to align BI initiatives with business objectives
Strong communication and presentation skills, with a focus on understanding and communicating the company’s core business
Strong leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and guide a diverse team
Proficiency in BI tools such as Redshift, Snowflake, Tableau, QlikView, QuickSight or similar platforms
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience in data visualization and statistical analysis
Knowledge of relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices

Manager, Product Management - Human Resources

In HR we are focused on building intuitive experiences for Capital One associates. Our product managers partner with cross functional teams of product, tech, design and data to define, design and build technology solutions that engage and serve thousands of associates daily.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Integrated Problem Solving

Develop and champion a bold vision that drives meaningful outcomes by embracing the art of the possible

Build frameworks for complex decision making that enable effective debate and accelerate getting to the right answer

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

The Operational Risk Officer is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.

Responsibilities:

Responsibilities:

Establishes and oversees the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and governance processes to create lasting solutions for minimizing losses from failed internal processes, inadequate controls, and emerging risks.
Independently assess’ risks and drive actions to address the root causes that persistently lead to operational risk losses by challenging both historical and proposed practices
Define and manage Operational Risk Management Products, liaise with stakeholders and technology partners
Responsible for oversight and execution of critical ORM Initiatives as a Program/Project manager, with required SME input
Define and manage Operational Risk Data Strategy including but not limited to performing data analysis to derive insights that can be used for effective identification and management of Operational Risk
Develop and maintain strong relationships with senior stakeholders across multiple organizations (internal and external)
Define Scope, Strategy and Success criteria for Operational Risk Transformation Programs
Identify risks, issues and critical interdependencies across programs/initiatives
Define requirements and manage Book of Work execution for Operational Risk Applications in the capacity of Product Owner
Manage adherence with all Citi Internal Processes including but not limited to creating and managing documentation that can evidence adherence
Provide Execution and Oversight support for Transformation Programs including effective Independent Challenge
Manage all program/project execution artifacts required for Business Completion and IA Validation of regulatory milestones and deliverables
Governance and oversight may include (not limited to) technology operational risk, risk for example.
Execution ownership of ORM assigned Consent Order RBCM (Regulatory Business Milestones)
Ownership, Execution, Delivery or ORM owned Programs/ Projects
Resolves transactional level escalations coming from the vendor or internal partners
Analyzes a multitude of scorecards/performance management tools in an attempt to mitigate exposure (risk/financial/regulatory)
Monitors goals are met through performance, risk and relationship oversight of our extended supply chain
Collaborates to resolve any issues which fall within the terms of the contract.
Develops and maintains relationships across the business users and Lines of Defense to better understand and deliver customer requirements by responding to changes in the internal and external business environment
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

6-10 years experience in product program governance and risk management framework.
Skills in risk management, business analysis, data, analytics, databases, data quality are desired; experience in database tools, Tableau, Power BI, visualization is preferred
Strong team player with excellent work ethics, attention to details and accuracy
Quick learner with strong communication, organizational & interpersonal skills with the ability to work with counterparts in various areas in the organization.
Should have Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office – particularly Excel (metrics and data analysis), PowerPoint (presentation decks), and Word (writing and editing procedural and technical documentation).
Good understanding of Risk Management and Operational Risk Management with some basic understanding of Financial Models
Knowledge of Data Governance and Strategy a plus

Bachelor’s/University degree required, Master’s degree preferred

Overview:
Who we are

Imagine working in a place where continuous improvement and innovation is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest & most iconic brands in the world.


As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as Slurpee® and Big Bite®. “Brain Freeze” is a 7-Eleven registered trademark for our 53-year old Slurpee® and with over 77,000 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over 14 million a month.


But there’s a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services.




At 7-Eleven the entrepreneurial spirit is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception 90+ years ago. It’s what drove us to invent the convenience industry in 1927 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to better serve the needs of our customers.




Today we are redefining convenience and the customer experience in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to come make history with us.


How we lead

At 7-Eleven we are guided by our Leadership Principles.




Be Customer Obsessed
Be Courageous with Your Point of View
Challenge the Status Quo
Act Like an Entrepreneur
Have an “It Can Be Done” Attitude
Do the Right Thing
Be Accountable

Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide the 7-Eleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores.


About This Opportunity
Responsibilities:

7Drive is 7-Eleven’s delivery division and we’re on a mission to bring on-demand delivery to cities and towns throughout the United States. We serve our communities by connecting our network of gig-economy drivers to restaurants, retailers, and grocers.


Responsibilities
Responsible for developing the pricing strategy and product strategy for 7NOW Marketplace.
Perform day to day analysis of 7NOW Marketplace pricing to determine overall effectiveness of various strategies and plan.
Prepare necessary financial modeling to determine pricing opportunities at a national and regional and promotional level.
Provide Product team data-driven insights and analysis to support ongoing sales and profitability growth.
Support analysis for delivery promotional activity on an ongoing basis by merchant
Evaluate competitive information to continually align pricing strategies within the marketplace.
Assess the impact of promotions on 7NOW Marketplace and present recommendations.
Manage the delivery P&L to ensure we drive profitability and operate within budget constraints.
Design frameworks for the team to develop A|B testing framework.
Synthesize data and analysis (e.g., A/B testing) to generate actionable insights to solve complex problems.
Conduct deep dive analysis to identify profitability optimization opportunities, apply problem solving methodology to drive sustainable improvements.
Apply existing and new solutions in creative ways to address complex issues and problems.
Build out advanced analytical capabilities and define analytical priorities.
Ability to independently analyze data, generate relevant insights, present to diverse audience, and convey sophisticated findings in a clear and impactful way. Ability to develop frameworks and train the teams do the same.
People Management: Coaching and mentoring analysts with a goal of developing and retaining high performing talent.
Qualifications:
Bachelors/4 Year Degree.
5+ years’ experience in pricing, financial and business analysis.
3+ years’ experience with data analytics programming in Javascript, Python SQL or equivalent.
1+ year experience in managing teams.
Experience in building models to predict financial impact of decisions.
Demonstrated proficiency in SQL and noSQL query syntax, data cleansing and data transformation.
Experience with data analytics tools such as PowerBI, Alteryx, SAS or equivalent.
Project management skills.
Ability to work in a team environment.

JOB DESCRIPTION


The Agile Enablement Lead plays a pivotal role in driving the Corporate Technology agility transformation. This position uniquely combines the analytical skills of a business analyst, the persuasive and clear communication of a corporate communications specialist, and the innovative approach of a marketer. A key aspect of this role will be the ability to use effective communication strategies to drive organization-wide change. The successful candidate will be comfortable communicating at all levels of the organization, adept at managing change, and able to bring thought leadership to the table.

Responsibilities:

Lead and influence the business agility transformation within the organization, using effective communication strategies to promote and drive change.
Evaluate current business operations using strong business analysis skills, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement changes as needed.
Develop and implement communication strategies that inform, engage, and motivate employees and other stakeholders throughout the agility transformation process.
Craft clear, compelling messages about our agility transformation for various audiences, including leadership, employees, and external stakeholders.
Apply a marketing mindset to operational issues, finding creative ways to promote and embed agility within the organization.
Contribute to the development and delivery of training materials and workshops to build agility capability within the organization.
Work collaboratively with various departments to facilitate the transition to more agile ways of working.
Monitor and evaluate the impact of agility initiatives, communicating progress and results effectively to all stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in business operations, marketing, communications, or a related role.
Experience driving agile transformations or implementing agile principles in a business setting.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret business data.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively lead change management initiatives and explain complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Innovative mindset with a track record of driving change and influencing organizational culture.
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of teams and stakeholders.

Description:

At Lockheed Martin, The Flight Line is the Center of Gravity™ – it’s where we are delivering integrated sustainment capabilities to ensure our customers’ aircraft are mission ready anytime and anywhere. Because minutes matter, Lockheed Martin’s 24/7 operations centers and sustainment engineers partner closely with the customer to solve new challenges and meet the needs of the Flight Line.

Our skilled Quality Control Flight Team, a part of our greater IFG directorate at Lockheed Martin Aeronautics is comprised of passionate and diverse people, all with a common mission to meet the needs of our customers while keeping our pilots safe.



WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU


In this rewarding career, you will find that your role impacts many and is key to the success of our IFG Fight Operations from a Quality Control Field Operations standpoint. You will be exposed to the F-16 aircraft MODs. With that exposure, learning/working with some of the best and brightest in our industry.
If you are craving an opportunity where you are invited to be passionate, push the envelope, and think outside of the box, this could be the opportunity for you, and we invite you to put your development and growth first by joining our amazing team.

This position is located in Fort Worth, Texas - Discover Fort Worth.



YOUR IMPACT


Supporting our IFG program as a Quality Control Field Operations Analyst, your primary impact will be making sure our F-16 aircraft are Quality Assured and Ready for Flight!
Your aviation maintenance data skills and flight line experience will benefit you as you are sought after for insights and solutions to keep everything running smoothly. From reviewing and maintaining forms through all phases of aircraft flight operations and test programs, to verifying completion of all flight discrepancies, and issuing QARs on flight discrepancies, you will oversee a wide range of tasks affecting Quality Control on the Flight Line.
Beyond that, you may also find yourself:

Coordinating and certifying aircraft release records at the movement of components and/or aircraft, ensuring the proper disposition of all QARs at time of release of aircraft and at time of DD-250.
Maintaining logbooks, preparing reports, logging records, directives, and correspondence.
Guiding and supervising maintenance administration functions.
Setting up, operating, and maintaining logistics hardware and systems.
Reviewing complete manufacturing documents and inspection records for completeness and accuracy.

Basic Qualifications:



Flightline Operations Experience


Experienced in maintaining aircraft records


Quality Assurance Experience

Desired Skills:



Microsoft Suites experience


Red X Military experience or similar experience

None

Job Title: Operations Analyst – Utilities

JOB PURPOSE: As an Operations Analyst –Utilities,this position is responsible for reporting and analysis on utility reimbursements, utility expenses, and energy consumption trends. This position will play an integral role in analyzing utilities expenses and reimbursements, identifying areas of improvement, providing recommendations for billing consistency, and presenting monthly and quarterly updates. They will assist in the development and review of annual utility budgets. They will work closely with the Regional Leadership Team and interact with our 3rd-party billing vendor and Technical Services Team.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Analyze utilities reimbursements, expense, and consumption to identify trends and areas of improvements.
Proactively review and investigate reimbursement, expense, and consumption data and resolve areas of concern with Regional Leadership and 3rd party billing vendor.
Assist in the preparation and review of annual utility reimbursement and expense budgets. Ensure there are budget notes that document budget inputs and variances.
Assist in the preparation of materials for Monthly/Quarterly Utility Reviews for Multifamily Leadership.
Document utility billing methods for each property and assist with review of any bill method change recommendations. Audit and document utility addendums.
Assist with the recommendations for billing methodologies for property acquisition set-ups.
Monitor daily and monthly usage alerts and track for resolution.
Learn and document the mandatory filing requirements. Works with 3rd-party vendor to ensure submitted timely and accurately.
Track and analyze utility rate changes.
Support data assembly and submission for Energy Star, ESG and other reporting requirements.
In coordination with Multifamily Leadership, Technical Services, and Business Services, scope projects to review, update, and implement (if applicable) operational SOP’s.
Other ad-hoc projects as assigned.

1-3 years of analyst experience in financial analysis. Multifamily industry preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, or related field, or combination of education and experience.
Familiarity with budgeting, utilities expense and reimbursement programs
Advanced Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) skills required.
Superior analytical, problem-solving, and business case development skills
Professional demeanor, strong judgement, maturity, and interpersonal skills.
A well-organized and self-directed individual, with exceptional time management skills, including the ability to work under tight deadlines, prioritize and efficiently manage multiple complex projects.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Job Title: Sr. Business Accountability Specialist- Analytics, Reporting & Presentation
Job Description:
About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Senior Business Accountability Specialist to join the HR Business Risk Management Team. The position will be responsible for standards and controls in the business, ensuring effective design, assessment, monitoring, and execution through establishment of protocols, assessment, risk mitigation, oversight, reporting, and self-assurance activities.

In this role, you will:
Be a key member of a growing and evolving team supporting Human Resources Risk Management.
Manage projects and drive initiatives through implementation.
Develop and organize standard documentation.
Coordinate and organize cross-team initiatives
Analyze reporting and data, including trending and themes
Develop executive presentations to tell the story of the data, forming clear calls-to-action
Lead or participate in moderately complex initiatives and deliverables within business and contribute to large-scale, cross-functional planning related to mitigation of current and emerging business risk issues and concerns
Assess, analyze, and design moderately complex controls, protocols, and approaches with respect to risk mitigation and the control environment, including ensuring effective planning for sustainability, ongoing control adherence, reporting, measurement, technology impacts, and monitoring
Independently make decisions and resolve moderately complex issues while leveraging solid understanding of the business's functional area or products, operations, and regulatory environment; facilitate decision-making and issue resolution, and support implementation of developed solutions and plans; lead peers and key business partners to meet deliverables and drive new initiatives
Collaborate and consult with peers, colleagues, and mid-level managers to address current and emerging risks associated with business activities and operations, and provide guidance or support in interpreting, developing, and implementing risk-mitigating strategies
Partner with peers and the business in interactions with external parties to support appropriateness and timeliness of response, and effectiveness of communications and materials
May serve as a mentor for lower-level staff

4+ years of risk management, business controls, quality assurance, business operations, compliance, or process experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education
Desired Qualifications:
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy
Project management experience
Experience identifying risk exposure and propose solutions as well as key issues, involve affected parties, design solutions, obtain buy-in and communicate effectively through resolution
Experience presenting information in a manner that persuades, educates, and enhances understanding at all levels

Experience with Power Bi and Tableau creating dashboards
Enhanced Microsoft Excel skills, including pivot tables, macros, charts, and VLOOKUPs.
Advanced PowerPoint design skills, including development of Executive decks, with the ability to tell complex stories succinctly and visually.

Overview:

With data deeply embedded in our DNA, PepsiCo Data & Analytics transforms data into consumer delight. We build and organize business-ready data that allows PepsiCo’s leaders to solve their problems with the highest degree of confidence. Our platform of data products and services ensures data is activated at scale. This enables new revenue streams, deeper partner relationships, new consumer experiences, and innovation across the enterprise.


Your role will be part of a growing team focused on supporting the Enterprise Data Organization (EDO) Operations team within PepsiCo. You will directly support the EDO Operations Lead with managing the EDO resourcing/staffing plans, budget considerations, and Annual Operating Plans. You will work closely and collaborate with the Enterprise Data Organization team to ensure monthly actuals and forecast resources and cost are maintained and implement new processes to streamline how the team operates. You will be one of the central point of connection for the Enterprise Data Organization Chapter to ensure the day to day resource and financial management of the team is executed seamlessly.

Steward and manage all open role budget forecasts and mapping for the team
